Platform come non ne giocavo da tempo, un bellissimo titolo in grado di intrattenere dall'inizio alla fine senza mai risultare ripetitivo o banale.
Trama simpatica e gameplay solido, corredato da uno stile grafico pulitissimo che se non fosse per alcune texture reggerebbe bene ancora oggi.

Consigliatissimo!

max，一款神奇的游戏，将冒险与画笔结合在一起，充满创意。
+2.5D的风格，画面很好看
+多种类型的画笔结合，组合过关
-垃圾的画笔游戏手感，画笔平时是“盖上盖子的”，只有在特定的地方才能用，运动的时候无法使用画笔
+-优秀的关卡设置，一些逃亡和子弹时间的运用，使游戏很畅快，但是这同样限制了玩法，只能完成框架内的操作，没有一代的那种异想天开的感觉
-诡异恶心的设定，如那个电人的萤火虫，恶心死人了，不想打第二遍，还有那个大瀑布关，用水冲树，恶心恶心恶心
总体上是推荐的，打分7/10
6小时一周目，收集还剩20%，但是因为某些地方太恶心了，通关就删

38170822.review:
O jogo é bom sim, divertidinho. Mas não é nada espetacular. 

• No que se refere à plataforma, o jogo não oferece nada novo ou interessante, com coisas manjadas de qualquer platformer que você venha a jogar e sem desafios.
• A história é extremamente simples e boba, como de um filme de animação genérico. Não que deveria ter uma história ótima e complexa, mas poderia ser contada de uma maneira mais interessante com personagens legais e tal.
• O gráficos é bom sim, não maravilhoso, mas é bem trabalhado.
• Quanto ao recurso da "caneta mágica", é bem interessante sim, mas foram poucos os momentos em que achei os puzzles bem desenvolvidos. Talvez porque o jogo seja direcionado ao público infantil, tendo uma dificuldade bem básica.
 • O jogo apresentou alguns bugs aqui, nos momentos em que fica slow-motion e não aparecendo nada para se fazer, tendo que reiniciar o jogo. Também achei os checkpoints automaticos do jogo bem travados, dando uma leve pausada quando passa por um, ao invés de seguir o gameplay fluido. Não sei se isso aconteceu só comigo, mas talvez aconteça caso você for jogar.


Por fim, não é o melhor jogo de puzzle ou plataforma que você pode comprar, mas vale a pena jogar, dá pra se divertir com ele. Pegue numa promoção e jogue para passar o tempo. Agora, caso você queira um jogo de puzzle nessa pegada de fantasia e envolvendo irmãos, tem o ótimo [b]Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons[/b], que vai te divertir (e emocionar) muito mais que [b]Max: The Curse Of Brotherhood[/b].

37955825.review:
我挚爱着第一部MAX，它是我玩的第一个PC游戏，给我留下的回忆也是最多的。因此给它的姊妹作抹黑让我虐心，但是它那让我不得不差评的违心玩法更让我心滴血。
MAX最大的优点是它的谜题从不只有一种解法，小MAX手中的笔能承载着你自由的想象推动游戏发展，虽说有限，但它对玩家参与度的追求仍是值得称道的，这本也是独属于游戏这第七艺术的童话。但MTCB却将之抛却殆尽，MAX的魔笔只能落笔于规定的地方，只能有固定的画法。要追求绚丽点的要素是好想法，你可以把画笔的墨水赋予不同的特征，甚至特效做得夸张点都没关系，但显然游戏采取了失败的做法，从此你的想象无从落笔，你的追求也写不进游戏的剧本。自由度？没有了。创造力？不见了。
为了表达我的心意，尽管第一部MAX转正无方，我愿全价付续作的价并全心地玩过它。但除此之外，我还能说什么呢？

36611315.review:
[h1]SHRNUTÍ[/h1]
Hru jednoznačně doporučuji. Je to plošinovka s fyzikálními hádankami a občasnými akčními sekvencemi s několika quicktime eventy a s využitím kouzelné fixy. Zpracování hry nelze nic vytknout.
+ grafika
+ kouzelná fixa
+ akční sekvence
+ občasné komentáře dění

[h1]DĚJ[/h1]
Max se vrátí domů a najde v pokoji svého mladšího bratra Felixe, jak si hraje. Jenže si evidentně hraje s hračkami, které patří Maxovi a navíc tak, že je rozbíjí. To Maxe vytočí a tak zadá do vyhledávače dotaz na to, jak se může zbavit bratra. Vybere si odkaz na kletbu, kterou vysloví. Ze zdi pokoje vyletí obrovská tlapa, která popadne malého brášku a zmizí s ním ve zdi. Max okamžitě lituje toho, co udělal a dokonce neváhá skočit do zavírajícího se portálu ve zdi. Max se ocitá neznámo kde a vidí, jak v dálce monstrum odnáší jeho brášku. A tak začíná jeho putování za jeho záchranou.

[h1]INSTALACE[/h1]
Do základní hry lze doinstalovat [url=https://prekladyher.eu/preklady/max-the-curse-of-brotherhood.240/]české titulky[/url] s úplnou diakritikou.

[h1]JAK SE HRAJE[/h1]
Hra "MAX: KLETBA BRATRSTVÍ" se ukládá automaticky a to po krátkých úsecích levelů. Dokonce lze pokračovat v rozehraném levelu po ukončení hry. Max na své cestě nejprve využívá prostředí tak jak je zvykem. Tady se zhoupne a tamhle zas posune kámen, aby mohl vyskočit výš. Postupně ale získává mocná kouzla do staré fixy, kterou má náhodou sebou. Postupně si s její pomocí podmaňuje svět kolem sebe. Na určitých místech tak může nejprve vytvářet sloup země, poté vytváří rovné i různě zahnuté větve stromů a později získá ještě další tři vychytávky. Ty lze a tedy se i musí kombinovat. V průběhu hraní lze plnit ještě vedlejší úkoly. První je trhání zlých kukadel (očí na stonku) a druhý je kompletace rozbitého medailonu. Části medailonu i zlá kukadla jsou samozřejmě ukryta na těžko dostupných místech.

36395648.review:
Один из самых красивых пазл-платформеров с уникальной механикой и неплохим, простеньким сюжетом. У вас есть маркер, при помощи которого вы продвигаетесь дальше по сюжету, рисуя в специально отведённых для этого местах различные объекты. По мере прохождения вам будут доступны маркеры других цветов, со своими уникальными "чернилами"

Виды маркеров:
Земля - возводит из земли возвышенность
Ветки - по которым можно карабкаться
Лианы - делает верёвки
Вода - перемещает на расстояние Макса или объекты
Огонь - уничтожает врагов и различные препятствия

Ловко сочетая всё это вам и предстоит спасти своего мелкого брата, которого вы сами же и прокляли. Однажды, придя со школы и увидев картину маслом "не играй в мои игрушки и не писай в мой горшок", герой решает наGIGGLEить "Как избавиться от брата". Читает заклинание и того похищает огромная мохнатая лапа чудовища из портала в другое измерение, куда следом, не раздумывая и прыгает Макс
Уровни разные и впечатления, что ты раз за разом проходишь один и тот же (как в каком-нибудь [url=store.steampowered.com/app/214560/Mark_of_the_Ninja/]Mark of the Ninja[/url]) не возникает. Тут тебе: и каньон, и лес, и пещера, и замок.
Если вы любите шикарные платформеры, типа: [url=store.steampowered.com/app/48000/LIMBO/]Limbo[/url], [url=store.steampowered.com/app/304430/INSIDE/]Inside[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/211400/Deadlight/]Deadlight[/url], то ни в коем случает не проходите мимо.

36154297.review:
I did not have any real expectations for the game, seeing as I paid less than $3. Unfortunately, despite being a decent game, Max is held back by a host of problems that ruined the experience.

The Good: The game has solid platforming, is a decent length for the price, clever puzzles and bright, colourful graphics.

The Bad: Occassional crashing with the Steam overlay enabled, constant hitching when loading a new section, messed up controller configuration (I ended up using mouse and keyboard which works fine).

The game lacks innovation and/or depth [I've had better experiences with platforming games in recent months]. It also uses the Unity engine which  could explain why there are so many problems; every game that uses it seems to be a POS.

Overall, I would not recommend Max: The Curse of Brotherhood, even at a severe discount. A console port with too many unresolved issues.

35162302.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood é um belo jogo de plataforma 2D cheio de puzzles que são resolvidos usando uma caneta mágica conforme vocês podem ver no trailer. O conceito da caneta não foi inventado pelo jogo e apesar de divertido e visualmente atraente não é muito usado justamente pela dificuldade de muitos em desenhar usando o controle.
Pra mim, o maior problema do jogo foi justamente com a caneta, como os desenhos geralmente são linhas, eu não tive problemas em desenhá-los, mas a maneira como a caneta funciona não é boa, por exemplo, Max fica imóvel ao utilizar a caneta (grande erro pq teria ficado mais interessante controlar Max/caneta ao mesmo tempo, por exemplo, ele poderia criar as plataformas enquanto pula de uma à outra)
A caneta também é usada nas partes de ação e Max imóvel para usá-la, mas tudo que está acontecendo a volta dele continua em movimento, então provavelmente é nessa parte que há algum risco de morrer no jogo pq errando o angulo do desenho não haverá uma segunda oportunidade. Também existe um bug que nunca será corrigido pq a desenvolvedora Press Play não existe mais, esse bug acontece nas partes de câmera lenta e o jogo trava (foram 5 ou 6 vezes pra mim durante todo o jogo).

Eu recomendo comprar Max: The Curse of Brotherhood apenas na promoção (apesar de muito bom, o preço cheio tá caro e não compensa pq o jogo é muito curto) e problemas citados não chegam a comprometer seu progresso durante o jogo que não é dificil. 7/10

34413504.review: 麦克斯·兄弟魔咒，刚开始玩的时候大概是15年上半年，当时刚刚通关了它的前作《麦克斯与魔法标记》，想找同类型的游戏玩，就找到了这款游戏，从三大妈上下载了盗版玩，而且各种玩不了，原来是XP系统玩不了，换掉系统后玩的乐不思蜀。这款解谜游戏流程上跟Limbo，Inside一样，但亮点在于[spoiler]主角拥有一支Magic Marker，可以画出诸如石柱、树枝、藤条、水流等东西，通过这些东西玩家一步步解谜探索[/spoiler]。游戏的故事也如标题所示，[spoiler]哥哥想让弟弟消失，玩笑成真，怪叔叔就把弟弟带走了，哥哥后悔莫及，一路探险拯救弟弟，最终获得成功[/spoiler]。另外，游戏画风很不错，光影、材质做的不错。游戏的氛围很卡通，很刺激，主角和NPC时不时的台词会把你逗乐。另外，还有很多收集要素，只要细心观察，探索，还是很容易全收集的。解谜难度并不高，操作难度中等，对重度手残患者极不友好。原价购买也不亏。安利一下。

34215925.review:
Świetna, pomysłowa, dająca wiele frajdy platformówka. Nie jest trudna, ale nie jest też przesadnie łatwa. Wcielamy się w postać dzieciaka - Maxa, przez którego brat Felix wpada w poważne tarapaty. Świadom swojego głupiego zachowania wyrusza na ratunek bratu w innym, alternatywnym świecie, pełnym potworów i pułapek. Wyposażony jedynie w pisaki, dzięki którym może dodawać i modyfikować nowe elementy otoczenia, rusza do zamku paskudnego starca, który potrzebuje Felixa, do odmłodzenia siebie i swojej pomarszczonej gęby. 

Pomimo liniowości gra się przyjemnie. Szkoda, że twórcy nie zostawili większego pola do popisu wyobraźni gracza. Grafika jest ładna, sterowanie bezbłędne. Jedynie miałbym uwagę do tego, że kamera zmieniała się we wielu momentach za wolno lub pisaki i możliwość dodania gałęzi, czy ziemi też pojawiały się wolno. Grę przeszedłem w 5 godzin, ale dla osób lubujących się w zdobywaniu osiągnięć gra może być dłuższa o godzinę, bądź dwie. Ogólnie polecam.

34148508.review:
Note: verdict, pro/con list and practical info can be found at the bottom of this review

[h1]|| Max: The curse of brotherhood - full review ||[/h1]

With [i]Max: The curse of brotherhood,[/i] the developers from [i]Press Play[/i] bring us a new 2d puzzle-platformer, which seems to be an all-around improvement of their previous game named [i]Max and the magic marker.[/i] In this title, we play as Max once again - on a mission to save our annoying little brother Felix, whom we 'accidently' sent away through a portal - to a magical and dangerous place. A place ruled by the fearsome Lord Mustacho; an old, bitter man who wishes to revitalise himself with a young spirit. Armed with a (magical) marker only, the grand adventure to save Felix from Mustacho begins!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1099528235
[h1]° Forget about guns and swords, a magic marker it is[/h1]

Upon arriving the magical lands that we sent our brother to, we receive strange powers for our - at first - seemingly useless marker. Those powers are granted by the wise old lady, who is portrayed as Mustacho's opponent. This new improved marker allows for the creation and destruction of various objects, such as dirt pillars, branches, vines ... which play an essential role in the game's puzzle-platforming sequences. Want to reach the top of a hill? How about you draw a dirt pillar to raise yourself all the way up. How to reach the other side of the tree? Why, just draw yourself a vine and swing across! 

[i]Max[/i] stays relatively fresh throughout as new mechanics are regularly introduced and each new chapter grants your marker with new powers, depending on the environment you find yourself in - or so it seemed. It must not have been a coincidence that within the forest, I reveived the power to draw branches and vines, whereas in the wetlands, I was able to create water streams to help me navigate through the levels.

[h1]° An engaging adventure[/h1]

I found the gameplay to be overall fun and exciting. It starts out pretty simple and basic, but in the later chapters you'll have to actively combine certain objects to complete the various puzzles that the game has in store. There are also certain 'escape' scenes to deal with, as in: run away from different threats against time. Most of the puzzles never get really challenging, but that didn't seem to bother me as they were always fun to do and solve. Some of them are quite creative too, which made for an enjoyable experience. Who says games need to be difficult in order to be fun? 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1101412967
The real 'difficulty' comes in another form than puzzle solving, and that is dealing with the somewhat ... clunky controls. More often than not - when I entered a new level -, I could figure out what to do pretty quickly. When I actually wanted to execute my solution, I would regularly fail because of how weird the controls can be from time to time. Jumping/climbing is not always as accurate, and let's not even talk about the amount of times I fell to my death whilst swinging on vines - missing my destination by mere millimeters. 

Onto the game's length and replay ability: The game consists of 7 chapters in total and lasts for about 6 to 7 hours, which I found to be just about right. Some additional hours could be acquired by hunting down all of the game's collectibles, which consist of destroying evil eyes and collecting secrets. The great thing is that you don't have to replay the whole game while looking for all achievements, as seperate chapters can easily be accessed in the main menu. Sadly, collecting all eyes & secrets doesn't really hold any significance within the story - it is merely a reason to catch 'em all. However, what good is a platformer without any sort of secrets to track down, right?

[h1]° A family friendly experience[/h1]

If one thing became clear whilst playing [i]Max,[/i] it is how child friendly this game truly is. From the story to the gameplay to the cutscenes, this game strikes me as something that could easily be enjoyed by the whole family. Right from the start - when I loaded up the game for the first time - until the end, I was filled with a somewhat nostalgic feeling, probably because of the charming music, the entertaining cinematics and the loveable cartoony look of the game. In a certain way, it kind of resembles games and cartoons I used to play/watch as a kid. If you're still not convinced, well, the game's antagonist is called Lord Mustacho ... LORD MUSTACHO!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1099527974
I do recommend this game, but please keep in mind that it is not a perfect game by any means. While the music is very charming and cute, it is rather simplistic and not all that memorable. Secondly, the game's got a sweet look, but don't expect AAA visuals. And lastly (and I mentioned this in the section above), the controls can be a bit odd/stubborn sometimes and can therefore make the game a little bit tedious/irritating at times. In the end, the game feels like an avarage title. Not amazingly good, but not bad either. Just good, but still definitely worth playing in my book.

[h1]|| Game overview ||[/h1]

[b]Verdict: - yes, if: you can look past its flaws | Definitely recommended on sale (=$2.50)[/b]

33410419.review:
Juego de plataformas y puzles en Unity. Está subtitulado al castellano y voces en inglés, aunque las voces son muy pocas (no se necesita más). Está hecho enteramente en 3D, pero las mecánicas son 2D. La cámara y el zoom se mueven solos, y salvo contadísimas excepciones (1 ó 2 en todo el juego) funcionan perfectamente, moviéndose para dar perspectiva y aprovechando los escenarios. La trama consiste en rescatar al hermano pequeño de Max al que mandas a un mundo "de fantasía" por romperte un juguete. Una excusa para tener plataformas/poderes y resolver puzles, con un fondo de "salvar al hermano", a lo "Dentro del laberinto".

-Gráficos/ambientación: Para ser un juego que dicen se hizo originariamente para tabletas (no sé si se referirán al juego anterior a éste...), y en Unity, se ve "muy bien". Los escenarios pecan de falta de detalle geométrico y las texturas son tipo las de juegos de hace 15 años en algunos modelos. Salvando esto, el toque suave y los no muy notorios bordes (que los hay, no se puede usar DSR, como con todo juego de Unity) hacen que parezca de una película de animación. Las animaciones son sencillas, pero dan ese toque de película de niños de ahora. Las físicas están bastante bien logradas para ser un juego "simple".

-Sonido/música: La música no es muy variada, pero encaja perfectamente, de nuevo. Suena a "película/serie" de dibujos. Las voces en inglés son aceptables, y los subtítulos en español correctos, no he visto nada mal escrito.

-"Jugabilidad": Saltas, mueves objetos y puedes usar un "rotulador" que va adquiriendo poderes: crear columnas de roca, troncos, lianas, corrientes de agua, chorros de fuego. Hay secretos y coleccionables en cada nivel que suelen ser casi siempre sencillos se recoger. No puedes guardar, sino que lo hace el juego automáticamente. Hay un problema: cada vez que guarda pega un tirón el juego y bajan las FPS (que serían estables a 60 -capado de serie-) al escribir. Este juego lo tengo en un HDD de alto rendimiento y pega tirones, no he probado a moverlo a un SSD (entendía que un juego de este tipo no necesitaba un SSD)... Salvo eso, el juego va totalmente fluido, no necesita nada de máquina. Se ve "muy bien" para lo poco que chupa.

Totalmente recomendable, de primera pasada unas 10h. Si buscas algún logro/coleccionable se puede ir a las 12-14h. Por 2'5€, de lo mejor que he encontrado. Se echa en falta algún nivel más a lo "DLC", que dé más juego a los poderes. Los puzles están muy bien hechos y cas el 100% de las veces se pueden resolver y volver sin tener que morir.


Gráficos: 7
Ambientación: 8'5
Música: 8
Voces: 7'5
Subtítulos: 10
"Jugabilidad": 9

[b]Total: 8'25/10[/b]

PD: Funciona perfectamente con mando "clónico" de XBOX, no sé qué dicen por ahí...

Ein richtig schönes, wunderbar abwechslungsreiches Jump'n'Run, das ich uneingeschränkt und sehr gerne empfehlen kann. Jedes Kapitel eine andere Szenerie und auch so gut wie jedes Level ist abwechslungsreich. Immer gibt es neue Rätsel, neue Verbindungen, mir wurde es nie langweilig (was leider oft bei 2D-Jump'n'Runs der Fall ist, da sich irgendwann doch eher alles wiederholt). Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist gerne mal etwas knackig, aber - fand ich - nie demotivierend. Als ein Spiel für Kinder würde ich es deshalb nicht bezeichnen, kindgerecht ist es aber auf jeden Fall. Sehr süß gemacht alles! Die angegebene Spielzeit von 6-7h... Joa, ist evtl machbar, wenn man sich echt gut anstellt und aber auch nichts sammelt. Ich habe sicher 5-7h gebraucht, um die Erfolge und den fehlenden Sammelkram noch zu holen. Auch dort ist der Schwierigkeitsgrad nicht zu hoch und die Erfolge lassen sich ganz gut holen - manche, vor allem die, bei denen man nicht sterben darf - das passiert nämlich schneller als man vielleicht zuerst denken mag -, sind aber doch auch gut fordernd. Übrigens hätte ich noch zwei weitere Errungenschaften für das Spiel: “Stirb 1000 Tode“ und “Stirb 200 mal auf kreative Weise“. Und auch dann hätte ich noch 100%. ;) 

Ich kann es echt uneingeschränkt empfehlen und bin total begeistert, da ich nicht erwartet hatte, dass es so viel Spaß machen würde!

32725792.review:
[h1]Review zu Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/h1]

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood ist ein netter kleiner JumpandRun, welcher mit seinem "Magic Marker", soweit ich weiß heißt dieser Filzstift so, eine extra Note reinbringt. Das Konzept bestimmte Dinge zu verändern und sich so den Weg durch  Wüsten, Wälder, Höhlen, Sümpfe, Vulkane etc. zu bahnen ist nicht nur sehr innovativ sondern macht besonders viel Spaß! Ab und zu gab es auch kleine Rätsel, die Meisten von ihnen waren leicht, doch eins war sogar so schwer, dass ich da im Internet nachgucken musste wie die Lösung lautete.
Jedenfalls muss ich alle Eltern an dieser Stelle warnen. Das Spiel ist nichts für Kinder! Jedenfalls würde ich es nicht meine Kinder spielen lassen. Es scheint an manchen Stellen zu schwer zu sein und das o. g. Rätsel war wirklich nicht leicht. Des Weiteren gibt es einzelne Passagen, welche tatsächlich eine recht gute Reaktion erfordern. Außerdem wenn man 100% schaffen möchte - so wie ich - wird sich auf Frust einstellen müssen. Um die begehrten 100% zu schaffen ist es nämlich notwendig in keinem Level zu sterben, dann kriegt man eine Medaille. Das Problem ist nur, wenn man mal sterben sollte -und das wird man - muss man sich die gesamten nicht vorspulbaren Cutscenes erneut anschauen. Das ist wirklich sehr ärgerlich. Allerdings nur wenn man die 100% haben möchte, soviel sei gesagt.

Kommen wir für die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Faszinierendes Konzept des Magic Markers
+ aktzeptable Grafik
Manche Texturen scheinen etwas zu verwaschen
+ gute Kameraführung
Großes Lob dafür! Diese ist wirklich sehr gut gelungen und in vielen anderen Platformern oft nervig. Hier jedoch nicht.
+ stetiger Wächsel zwischen Rätsel, Timing und JumpandRun
+ Die einsammelbaren Gegenstände sind Augen, welche sogar zu Mustacho, dem Bösewicht gehören. Eine recht interessante Möglichkeit Einsammelbares interessant zu gestalten. Wenn man in regelmäßigen Abständen anhand der Zahl sie rausreißt beschwert sich Mustacho per Filmsequenz darüber. Recht gut gemacht.
+ Bosskämpfe
Sowohl Mustacho als auch ein Lavamonster und wenn man so will auch die Bestie sind jetzt einfach mal Beispiele.
+ Xbox 360-Controller funktioniert tadellos. Jedoch sei gesagt, dass es manchmal Stellen gibt, in denen tatsächlich Maus und Tastatur von Vorteil sind
+ Auch die Maus und Tastatur Steuerung funktioniert einwandfrei! Recht selten so etwas! 

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- Ich hatte bruchteilsekündige Frameeinbrüche. Ich weiß nicht ob andere diese ebenfalls hatten.
- Es gibt nur 2 Arten von Gegner. Diejenigen mit Keule und diejenigen mit Bomben.

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Hauptgeschichte beantwortet nicht viele Fragen. Woher kennen sich Mustacho und die alte Lady? Was ist das Motiv von Mustacho? Über die Hintergrundwelt erfährt man auch nur recht wenig. Allerdings will das Spiel auch nicht. Ich hätte es mir lediglich gewünscht.

Insgesamt braucht man vielleicht 4-6 Spielstunden um einmal durch die Geschichte zu kommen. Eine recht kurze Spielzeit, doch nutzt Max: The Curse of Brotherhood diese richtig und langweilt zum Ende nicht. Lieber eine kurze und gute Geschichte, statt einer langen Langweiligen. Ich persönlich würde dafür keine 14,99€ zahlen. Jeder wie er will, aber ich finde das schon arg teuer für ein Platformer diesen Ausmaßes.

32142879.review:
Sur papier [b]Max : The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] semble être un nouveau membre du club très fourni des jeux de puzzle-plateforme que l’on trouve sur PC. Dans la pratique toutefois, le jeu réussit à se sortir un peu de la masse grâce à un concept simple : permettre au joueur de dessiner les solutions aux énigmes qui se dresseront devant lui. A l’aide d’un crayon qui se verra doter de pouvoirs de plus en plus variés, Max pourra donc dessiner des branches sur lesquelles grimper, des lianes où s’accrocher ou encore des geysers d’eau qui le propulseront dans des zones autrement inaccessibles.

Dans le domaine visuel, Max assure le job avec une 2,5D de bon niveau, même si les environnements restent dans le domaine du classique : désert, forêt, grotte et château sont au programme. Pareil pour les séquences de gameplay qui ressemblent énormément à un condensé de ce qu’on trouve ailleurs. Le soucis est plutôt du côté des contrôles. Expédions immédiatement la question du portage PC. Si le jeu est jouable au duo clavier-souris, on sent qu’il est plus confortable au pad. Outre le fait qu’il faudra faire avec un mapping des touches prévus pour un clavier qwerty, le moindre déplacement de la souris provoquera l’apparition du crayon. Déjà fatiguant à lui seul, ce choix devient franchement exaspérant dès lors que s’ajoute le fait que le crayon apparaisse au centre de l’écran et non là où le pointeur se trouve. Gênant quand l'action s'emballe.

Mon expérience avec Max : The Curse of Brotherhood m’a laissé une impression un peu mitigée, bien qu’il ne s’agisse pas d’un mauvais jeu. D’un côté, le jeu profite d’un concept sympathique et d’une réalisation visuelle correcte. De l’autre, le jeu est loin d’être aussi facile que pourrait le laisser penser sa patte graphique et j’aurais un peu de mal à le recommander à un enfant.

[b][u]Les plus[/u][/b]
[list]
    [*]Bon concept
    [*]Régulièrement de nouvelles mécaniques
    [*]Visuellement correct
[/list]
[b][u]Les moins[/u][/b]
[list]
    [*]Contrôle clavier/souris très moyen
    [*]Manque de réactivité du crayon quand l’action est rapide
    [*]Certaines énigmes à la physique aléatoire
[/list]

32076023.review: Me ha gustado bastante, un juego plataformero de 10

32070524.review:
Max The Curse of Brotherhood iss kleines aber feines Jump and Run Rätselspiel. 
Das Spiel ist an sich ein realtiv kindlich gestaltetes Adventure. Die Story lässt sich in einer Satz beschreiben. Ein kleiner Junge, findet seinen Bruder nervig, dieser wird in eine Welt verbannt und dein Ziel: Rette deinen Bruder. Ok richtig klasse ist die Story nicht, aber muss sie auch nicht. Das Spiel hält sich in einem 2D/3D Stil, der gut funktioniert. Die Kamera ist erstaunlich gut und passt sich dem Spielgeschehen gut an. Das Gameplay wechselt zwischen Actionszenen, Rätselpassagen und Jump and Run einlagen umher. Dabei ist das klassische hüpfen angesagt. Kernelement ist jedoch ein Stift, mit dem sich die Elemente an vorgegebenen Stellen verändern lassen können. Das ist motivierend, spaßig und über den Spielverlauf abwechselnd. Leider sind die Rätsel hingegen relativ einfach. Gut, es ist ein Spiel, das man auch in jüngerem Alter durchaus Spielen kann, aber so wirklich fordernd war keines der ,,Rätsel,,. Die Steuerung ist dabei relativ präzise und funktioniert einwandfrei. Die Grafik des Spieles ist wunderschön und das Szetting über die  7 Kapitel hinweg abwechslungsreich. Der Soundtrack ist dazu stimmungsvoll und gliedert sich gut in das Spielgeschehen ein.

Insegesamt ist Max TCOB ein durchaus gutes Spiel, das das Genre nicht neu erfindet, aber durchaus durch seinen tollen Stil, den toll integrierten Elementen und den irgendwie niedlichen Charm begeistern kann. Trotzdem muss ich sagen, dass es nicht für jederman eine Empfehlung ist, da die Story schwächelt und es sich nicht umbedingt nach etwas innovativem anfühlt. Wer aber ein kleines Jump and Run sucht, das gut aussieht und interessant gestaltet ist, dem kann ich Max TCOB nur ans Herz legen, sich es einmal anzuschauen.

30254310.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood é um excelente jogo, do começo ao fim. Confesso que eu comprei ele a muito tempo atrás em uma dessas promoções do Steam, o mesmo ficou um bom tempo na minha biblioteca parado e esquecido até que, nesse feriadão de carnaval (2017), eu resolvi dar uma chance… E fiquei extremamente impressionado com a qualidade deste pequeno indie.


# E FOI ASSIM QUE TUDO COMEÇOU….

Após ter feito um voodoo encontrado no “Google” para se livrar do seu irmão mais novo e chato, Max precisa superar seus medos e atravessar sete mundos para salvá-lo (depois de se arrepender do feito, claro) das garras de um supervilão que busca o poder e a vida eterna. Durante a jornada somos apresentada a uma simpática vovó que, além de nos guiar pelo pior caminho possível até nosso querido irmão em apuros, nos presenteia com uma magnífica e poderosa arma.... uma CANETA! Sim, isso mesmo, e ela é dotada de poderes mágicos que ajudam o nosso herói a superar todos os obstáculos em seu caminho.

A história é básica, serve para dar um contexto na aventura e cumpre bem o seu papel.


# A MISTURA PERFEITA ENTRE PUZZLE E PLATAFORMA

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood lembra bastante o jogo Limbo, a cada passo que você dá esta propenso a ter uma terrível morte… Esmagado por uma pedra, caindo de um precipício, afogado, queimado, soterrado, engolido e estraçalhado por monstros… Morrer, morrer e morrer… Isso é o que mais vai acontecer durante as horas de jogatina. Mas não é só a morte que se resume essa experiência, há muitos Puzzles também e é nesses momentos em que Max: TCoB me lembrou um pouco o jogo Trine.

Apesar de não poder trocar de personagem (como em Trine) para enfrentar os desafios, nosso herói possui uma caneta com propriedades mágicas capaz de “desenhar” objetos, como plataformas, cordas e muito mais. Em alguns momentos você precisara pensar bem para superar os quebra cabeças, em outros será necessário combinar a habilidade de fuga com pequenos puzzles/obstáculos que precisarão ser resolvidos em questões de segundos, caso contrário só restara a morte.


# ÓTIMA TRILHA SONORA

E eu não poderia deixar de falar da trilha sonora deste jogo, claro, porque ela ótima!

Desde as pequenas melodias enquanto exploramos o cenário e passamos pelos desafios mais simples, até as grandes fugas, as músicas são bem empolgantes e cumprem bem o papel na atmosfera do jogo.

O trabalho com a dublagem dos personagens é ótimo também, Max fala muito durante sua viagem, faz algumas piadinhas, grita muito…. E tudo isso é bem legal, complementa muito bem o jogo.


# UMA BOA JOGABILIDADE

No começo controlar Max e a Caneta parece um tanto confuso, pois no momento em que você usar seu artefato mágico também estará impossibilita de andar. Isso torna a experiência um tanto quanto irritante ao menos no começo, principalmente durante as perseguições, mas também é algo que você supera naturalmente mediante força de vontade e esforço.

Um dos pontos mais altos em Max: TCoB é a fluidez, eu particularmente sou muito chato com jogos de plataforma em 2D/2.5D, pois uma jogabilidade travada destrói muito facilmente qualquer jogo do gênero, por melhor que ele seja. Felizmente não temos esse problema aqui, os comandos são bem responsivos, não há bugs que atrapalhem o andamento do jogo e a física em geral esta ótima, tornando a experiência muito agradável.


# QUALIDADE GRÁFICA EXCELENTE

Sem dúvida esse é mais um dos pontos altos em Max: TCoB. Eu não diria que ele está a altura do belo trabalho feito em Trine 2, mas também não diria que está tão distante assim. Os cenários são repletos de detalhes, efeitos de luz e sombra bem otimizados (é possível ver a sombra do personagem projetada do outro lado do cenário, de acordo com o ângulo da iluminação e ambiente), cutscenes bem-feitas e boas animações no geral.

O jogo é um primor e não exige muito hardware, qualquer notebook com uma GPU “Intel HD 4000” ou superior é capaz de rodá-lo em qualidade média sem problemas e ele continua lindo de encher os olhos.


# CONCLUSÃO: COMPRE LOGO…. VALE A PENA!

Sim, está mais do que obvio que eu vou recomendar este jogo. Ele não só possui uma boa história (apensar de simples), jogabilidade e boa qualidade gráfica, como também é divertido abeça e desafiador.

É o tipo de jogo que agrada, que da até vontade de jogar os níveis outra vez para platinar (se você é do tipo que gosta disso) e curtir uma jogatina com as crianças em casa (se você for pai ou tio). Comprando o jogo em preço full ou em promoção, não importa, Max: The Curse of Brotherhood vale cada centavo que você vai perder da sua conta bancária! =)

29348296.review:
Another of these somewhat buried platformers from a couple years back. This one happens to be exceptional. The nice thing on PC, compared to the consoles, is that we have native 4K here. Along with injected SMAA the image quality is two or three tiers better than anything I saw on the consoles, which were very jaggy and blurry.

Don't get me wrong the visuals are still basic, but they are also on point and nicely detailed for the world that Max inhabits. This game has a tremendously old school vibe akin to Heart of Darkness from ages ago. I think people into platformers, and more or less that style of game, will dig this one too. It might turn off some people not quite used to the leisurely pace and childish exterior. The game picks up, though, and before you know it you will be finishing it as the later stages usually have two levels per world. Still, it's a decent 6-10 hour game.

Thematically, it fits in perfectly with a slightly stylized realism that builds itself around somewhat realistic physics. The big draw here is obviously the marker, and you can do a decent variety of things throughout in your quest to save your brother. Drawing vines and branches along with raising rock platforms will be the major concepts in play. The puzzles range from easy to tough and the checkpoints are frequent enough so as to not ♥♥♥♥ you off too much.

MGS and Press Play created a great game here, and it deserves to be played if you have the time. And even if you don't, this game lends itself to extremely short play sessions. There isn't anything out there quite like it so give it a try when you can.

28879976.review:
[h1]Análise Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/h1]

[u]História[/u]
A história do game é simples, você (Max) a partir de um ritual leva seu irmão a um mundo paralelo que conta com um grande vlão que o sequestra, sua missão ao longo do jogo é resgatá-lo. Apesar de a história ser simples, a mesma é muito bem contada, através de cinemáticas e cenas in-game.

[u]Gráficos[/u]
Os gráficos do jogo seguem o estilo das animações mais atuais, porém não chegam a um nível de qualdiade absurdo, porém cumprem seu papel. As cinemáticas sim, apesar de poucas, tem uma qualidade bem alta. Enfim, os gráficos são simples, porém bem trabalhados, alguns cenários são realmente lindos.

[u]Jogabilidade[/u]
Devido a ser um game do estilo plataforma, sem dúvidas o gameplay é o mais importante neste jogo. O game conta com 24 fases, divididas em 7 estágios. Você atravessa as fases podendo andar, pular, e utilizar a sua caneta (o grande atrativo do jogo). A caneta possibilita que você interaja com o cenários, cirando plataformas, cipós, galhos, correntes d'água e afins. A caneta ganha novos pdoeres ao longo do jogo, renovando o gameplay, evitando que o mesmo fique cansativo. 
Com estes comandos você supera as fases passando por puzzles, que aumentam de dificuldade gradativamente, tem uma dificuldade tranquila, dificilmente você vai empacar em algum.

[u]Trilha Sonora[/u]
A trilha do jogo cumpre seu papel, nada mais, ela conta com músicas no estilo mais clássico de desenhos infantis, enfim, casa completamente com a proposta e os gráficos do jogo. A dublagem (em inglês) também é muito boa.

[u]Conclusão[/u]
[b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] é um game surpreendente, paguei-o em uma promoção não esperando muito, porém encontrei 9 horas de pura diversão, tanto que peguei todos os colecionáveis do game ao longo das fases. Sem dúvida alguma vale a pena pegá-lo em uma promoção, contudo acho que o preço integral é bem justo também pelo que ele entrega. Se você procura um jogo plataforma com uma história leve e divertida e um gameplay fluído, sem dúvidas este game é uma boa pedida.

28847994.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood est un très bon jeu de plate-formes en 2.5D qui reprend le gameplay de Max and the Magic Marker sorti sur l'eShop de la Wii il y a quelques années.

Le joueur y incarne Max, un enfant qui doit aller sauver son frère Félix de l'emprise de Mustacho. Il sera pour cela aidé d'une vieille dame qui lui donnera des pouvoirs via son marqueur.
Le jeu vous occupera environ 6h si vous le faites en ligne droite mais vous demandera un peu plus de temps pour récupérer tous les yeux et les fragments de médaillon.
Le marqueur et ses différents pouvoirs est à la base du gameplay du jeu. En effet, les différents pouvoirs que vous obtiendrez au fil du jeu vous aideront à traverser différentes situations tout au long des 7 chapitres qui composent celui-ci. Vous pourrez par exemple créer des pilliers sortant de terre pour atteindre des plates-formes en hauteur, tracer des branches pour former des ponts, créer des lianes pour traverser du vide, tracer des cours d'eau ou encore utiliser des boules de feu pour ouvrir certains passages. Tous ces éléments doivent être créés à des emplacements précis et dans un rayon d'action délimité, ce qui laisse peu de place pour l'improvisation.

Les points forts du jeu sont : 
- Les graphismes : de la forêt au château en passant par des grottes le rendu graphique en 2.5D est très agréable.
- L'univers : le jeu propose un univers enfantin assez rare par rapport aux productions actuelles
- Les animations : Les animations sont très bien faites et on remarque même quelques petits détails plaisants comme le fait que Max se cogne la tête lorsqu'il ne se baisse pas ou qu'il s'écroule lorsqu'il reçoit un objet sur la tête.
- Le prix : proposé à 15€ en temps normal, j'ai personnellement payé le jeu 3€ en période de soldes. Ce qui reste largement abordable pour un jeu de ce type !

Les points plus négatifs sont :
- La maniabilité du marqueur : J'ai personnellement fait le jeu au clavier et à la souris et la prise en main était acceptable, la souris sert alors à dessiner les différents éléments tandis que zqsd servent à déplacer Max et la barre espace à sauter. Sachant que vous ne pouvez pas utiliser le marqueur tout en déplaçant Max, cela implique de relacher les touches de direction pour dessiner. En de rares occasions, certaines scènes d'action ralentiront le temps pour vous laisser dessiner certains éléments à la volée et ainsi éviter une mort certaine. Et vous risquez bien de mourir. Plus d'une fois. Je n'ai pas eu l'occasion de tester le jeu à la manette, mais j'imagine que les dessins se font au stick droit et les déplacements au stick gauche. En ce qui concerne la maniabilité, je vous conseille de télécharger la démo si vous voulez vous faire une idée avant d'investir.
- Des pics de difficulté parfois mal dosés : certains passages sont volontairement plus difficiles que d'autres et la maniabilité n'aidant pas, ces passages donnent au jeu un aspect die & retry qui nécessite des sauts très précis et une exécution exigente, ce qui va -a priori- à l'encontre du style graphique assez enfantin du jeu.
- La physique parfois hasardeuse des éléments créés : Je pense notamment à la difficulté de tirer ou pousser certaines branches ou encore au manque d'élan en sautant d'une liane fraichement tracée

Pour conclure je vous recommande chaudement Max: The Curse of Brotherhood si vous cherchez un jeu d'aventure/plate-forme en 2.5D qui pourra vous occuper quelques heures.

28504053.review: 多年以前只会玩网游从未接触过单机大作的我 某天玩腻了网游寻找一些单机小游戏时发现了一款名为《麦克斯与魔法标记》的游戏，“神笔马良”的游戏方式给当时的我留下了极其深刻的印象，多年以后无意中想起了这款游戏便尝试在steam上搜索看看，结果真的搜索到了，然而不知道什么原因无法购买，但我却有了一个意外的发现——它的续作，也就是这款游戏《麦克斯：兄弟魔咒》。趁着打折我买来通关了一遍，不得不说本作与前作相比改变非常大，首先就是画面的3D化，还有就是游戏中的角色们加入了对白配音，主角也有了各种音效，原本只能画出线条的画笔也拥有了许多种不同的能力，可以画出树枝、藤蔓、水流甚至是发射小火球，但却取消了墨水收集的设定变成了只能在固定的地点吸收有限的墨水画出指定的东西，不能像前作那样可以在屏幕上的任何一个地方乱涂乱画，也不能画个圈圈把怪物砸死或者是画个跷跷板把自己弹飞了，特别是还添加了多余的画笔收放的设定严重影响了操作的流畅性。总体来说虽然本作自由性不如前作，创意也没前作令人印象深刻，但我觉得还是值得一玩的。

28320239.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood has been a pleasing experience on the eyes. I got sick over the weekend and wanted something childish to entertain myself. And this game has "children game" screaming all over it.

That being said, it reminded me of the days when I was young, and we were stuck infront of the TV trying to solve donkey kong levels and crash bandicoots. This game is like a mixture of those old games and Trine where you need to "draw" things to help solve the different levels.

I was a little intimidated by having to jump around and draw at the same time, however any moment where you're in action. (Like running from a giant child-eating monster) and have to draw a rope, or a bridge, or something the time slows down. It's still challenging enough that I mess up and die a few times, but easy enough that I could easily see this being one of the first games a child tries to play.

I had quite a few good laughs on Max's behalf, his animations were lovely. You could crawl through narrow spaces, but if you didn't do it soon enough you'd hit Max's big head. I giggled. Several times. As Max hit his head, fell down, got stuff thrown ontop of him as he moaned, complained and cried.

Pick this up on the next sale! It's worth the few hours :) Only a pity the developing company got bought by another company that isn't focusing on PC games. I'd love to see more stuff from these guys!

28135058.review:
[b] Max: Curse of the Brotherhood is a puzzle platform adventure, which is heavy on a cinematic style, action-rich sequences and gives you a little bit of freedom on how to solve the puzzles. A good and enjoyable game overall, the overly simplistic story and minor technical flaws prevent it from being anything greater.[/b] 

[h1]What I liked:[/h1]
+ action-rich and cinematic opening
+ beautiful 2.5 D level design
+ awesome world and monsters
+ animations very well done
+ good music
+ decent savepoints, but sometimes unfairly BEFORE an unskippable cutscene
+ marker not only for puzzles, but as a flashlight
+ physic puzzles of sweeping away bug
+ fancy slow-motion puzzles
+ use of cage to solve puzzles
+ 6 hours playtime, just right

[h1]What I didn't like:[/h1]
- puzzle solutions obvious, I wish I could draw whatever, wherever
- no rebindable keys!
- the marker is way too big
- alt+tab lead to instabilities
- no sensitivity adjustment
- pillars can't be adjusted, have to be redrawn
- exploding tiny creates annoying and unnecessary
- cutscene not triggered
- puzzles sometimes very fiddly
- most of the puzzles are very obvious
- story foreseeable and very stereotypical


[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
[b] Wait for a sale.[/b] Max: Curse of the Brotherhood is a puzzle adventure plattformer I liked most for its very cinematic 2.5 D artstyle and it's heavy cinematic style. However, the supposed freedom you had for solving the puzzles only lead to minor variances in solving the puzzles. Rarely you get the chance to come up with truly something of your own. Additionally technical annoyances like the inability to adjust the mouse sensitivity in the options and non-skippable cutscenes in addition to the stereotypical story of "bad guy captures person you love, find and defeat him" prevent this game from being anything exceptional.


6 hours

27815755.review:
This is the modern and poorer reincarnation of the 90's hit gane Heart of Darkness. Your goal in this puzzle platformer is to find and rescue your younger sibling who was kidnapped and carried away into strange world by a monster on your own wish. This game reminds me Limbo with all the pitfalls and deaths from falling into pits, but has much more cheerful tone in general. Additional novelty is the magic marker that allows you to modify environments. I've been playing with my 3-year old son and he had even better time watching than me playing :D He was also scared shitless when we were chased by lava or a monster, but refused to stop watching. All in all, I had fun too. Score: 6/10 (add +1 if you have less than 10 years). 

pros:
- graphics and sfx
- some smart puzzles
- a magic marker concept

cons
- your helper and your main enemy (wtf?)
- quite short and repeatable
- puzzles with slow motion
- a bug with my progress hidden (twice) - I had to restart the game in order to continue and I discovered, that because the creator developer dissappeared, there's no real support anymore.

27755392.review:
Very fun and enjoyable game!

I've played it myself and enjoyed it very much. The drawing mechanics are very refreshing and give the adventure a unique touch! Graphics look great for what it is.

Some time later I introduced my girlfriend to gaming, and she started with Max: The Curse of Brotherhood. Her last gaming experience had been Aladdin on the SEGA Mega Drive. I loved watching her playing. The difficulty was just right, the story entertaining and straight to the point, and the mechanics familiar enough to what she remembrered.

I'd recommend it to anyone whose looking for uncommited fun, from experient gamers to people who neve really gamed before.

26369152.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood was an extraordinarily enjoyable puzzle platformer. I had relatively high expectations going in due to the number of positive reviews on steam, and I'm glad those expectations were met and then some. I hardly knew anything about this game going in, and I assume that helped.

Pros:
- Awesome, solid gameplay! I enjoyed all the puzzle solving you had to do in this game. The mechanics were so simple but gratifying and fun. I never got bored playing this. You grow what you need and in what shape.
- Straightforward, innocent plot. The game didn't take itself too seriously or too over the board ridiculous. It was a happy medium involving a story about a boy going to save his brother.
- Length. It ran about 7 hours, which I think is a wonderful length for this type of game.
- The look of everything was pleasing to the eye.

Cons:
- I'm really having a hard time thinking of a con for this game. It really was everything I expected! 

I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys solving puzzles and fun side scroller platforming!

The closest thing to a jump scare you'll find in this game is the occasional tentacle thing popping out that you don't expect. This game isn't scary at all.

26193034.review:
Max: The Curse of the Brotherhood is a pretty slick puzzle platformer. It's well animated with good cut scenes, the graphics look good, and it's very nicely voiced too. The first Max and the Magic Marker game was pretty good, but this is a vast improvement. Instead of drawing items while making sure you have enough ink to do so, all marker actions are context specific and ink management is no longer a concern, which makes the puzzles a lot tighter with a specific solution, but also more enjoyable because you'll always have the right amount of ink to find the correct solution to each puzzle/obstacle.

You don't need to play the first game at all to enjoy the Curse of the Brotherhood, so feel free to skip the first game entirely. The plot of this game doesn't tie in with the first much at all, and closely resembles the 1986 David Bowie film "Labyrinth", in which an older sibling asks the goblin king (in the case of Max, he goes on the internet and asks an old man with a mustache... creepy) to take his/her younger brother away, and when it actually works he/she has to go into a fantasy land to save him.

I played Max on a laptop and tried a number of input methods, the best by far I found to be using an Xinput compatible controller (I used an FC30 Pro, but any Xbox style controller should do the job). Touch screen wasn't usable which was pretty disappointing, and though the mouse trackpad did work, some time-sensitive actions were impossible to carry out using the trackpad. A regular mouse would probably be fine, but the controller has the advantage of the magic marker snapping-to on the nearest interactive object, and continuous direction by holding down the analogue stick, which is important in the later levels where you have to raise yourself up on high platforms quite quickly.

[h1]8/10 - Worth [i]marking[/i] in your wishlist if you like puzzle platformers[/h1]

25722032.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is a truly enjoyable platformer.  The artwork is stunning; as are the model designs, textures, and animation.  The ambient audio, music, and voice acting are all wonderful.  The level design is, for the most part, innovative and challenging; occasionally erring on the side of either too difficult or too easy.  The story is interesting, even if simple, and the main character is quite likable.

The game isn't perfect, however.  First, the story and world are shamelessly similar in concept to Limbo.  The oracle and villain characters are as generic and unsophisticated as can be and, aside from the one boss, the game has only one baddie.  Also, the control mechanics are extremely challenging; whether you go with a keyboard and mouse or brave the controller.

Even with its problems, Max is worth every penny I spent on it and every moment I spent playing it.  I recommend it highly.

25652689.review:
Unless you were a younger sibling you are going to deny it. Those pesky younger siblings just get in the way of your fun time always wanting to be in your way. So some of us can relate to poor Max when he types into Giggle …” how to make my brother go away”! Since this is a videogame and not real life it ACTUALLY happens and Felix gets sucked into another world. It up to Max to save him. It is his fault after all…..

[u]Artwork and Voice Acting [/u]

This game look gorgeous even on my laptop which has poor specifications. On a better powered system this game would look amazing. The voice work was a treat to the ears and had a lot of personality to it. Max sounds like a cocky young kid and some of his lines are funny. Felix sounds…. whiny, our villain sounds campy and old lady sounds… old and wise.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=764785732

[u]Gameplay[/u]

The game mechanic is the use of a marker to solve many puzzles over several chapters to save Felix. I didn’t have this issue but I feel I should mention it. Some players may prefer keyboard and mouse controls as the puzzles get complex to draw for better accuracy. The checkpoints in this game are generous. For the longer time based sections, the slow motion transitions give the player more than enough time to get drawing.

For the most part, especially in earlier stages, the solution seems easy. However, your success at progressing is going to depend on several things: getting your drawings right, angles, precision and speed which becomes more obvious with game progression. What this puzzle platformer gets right, which some games fail at, is getting the difficulty spike just right. It introduces more elements and intricate puzzles at an even pace so you don’t feel frustrated and overwhelmed at any point.

After a long journey to get to the big boss the final fight left me feeling “is that it?”. However, on reflection I remembered that this is a family friendly puzzle platformer and if it was too hard it might be a problem. And I also realised he’s called mustacho…. [b]MUSTACHO[/b]!! Ultimately I decided this is all about the journey so I decided to let this one go in the end.

[u]Conclusion[/u]

For the gamers who like to collect or gain achievements there is some extended play in this. I consider this an [b]essential [/b] purchase if you like cute family puzzle platformer This game is on [I]frequent sale [/I] at the 75% mark which having played this is criminal. After playing this I would of payed a lot more. Make sure to grab it in a sale if it’s your cup of tea or at least try the demo out….

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood, juego producido por Microsoft Studios y muy parecido a Ori and the Blind Forest en mecanicas, pero bueno vamos a analizarlo. Este juego es un juego de plataformas con un apartado artistico muy trabajado a decir verdad los colores del mapeado y el diseño te entran por los ojos y eso es un gran punto a favor.

En cuanto  a las mecanicas el juego esta mas que bien acompañado por un accesorio que trae el propio personaje que es un "rotulador magico" el cual nos permitira movernos en este aspecto perfectamente. Tambien este juego a parte de plataformeo consta con varios puzzles que aunque no sean muy dificiles alguno que otro te va a llevar unos minutos poder descifrarlo a decir verdad. 

Hablando del mapeado el juego es muy variable con unos mapas espectaculares muy bonitos y con una ambientacion y una musica espectacular.El diseño es bestial y no solo por el mapeado si no que el juego se hace ameno porque no es repetitivo por eso a mi parecer lo hace bastante decente.

El juego si te paras a buscar logros y demas porque eso es otra tiene el "extra" de recoger unos ciertos objetos para logros y demas que es un plus para el juego bastante adecuado, nos durara unos 10 horas mas o menos asi que en esta parte esta bastante decente.

Que mas decir de este juego es una compra segura en mi opinion es divertido, visualmente precioso, con puzzles y fisicas muy buenas y con unos mapeados y niveles espectaculares. 9/10

24750009.review:
Un platform puzzle in 2D brillante, con un level design divino, una grafica cartunesca ma molto apprezzabile e un atmosfera azzeccatissima.
Introduzione senza veri spoiler. Il nostro viaggio inizierà quando il nostro fratellino verrà rapito da misteriose creature in un misterioso mondo per colpa nostra, verremo donati di un potere che ci permetterà di muovere vari elementi naturali con un pennarello. Con questi poteri che via via aumenteranno andremo dietro ai rapitori di nostro fratello a suon di puzzle e fasi platform che spesso e volentieri vanno anche a unirsi. I puzzle saranno spesso intuitivi ma ci capiterà anche di dover spremere non poco le meningi, niente che possa diventare veramente frustrante, tutto ciò di cui hai bisogno  per superarli c'è l'hai davanti ed essendo i controlli molto chiari non ci sono scuse del tipo "non potevo saperlo", se non si riesce ad avanzare è solo colpa propia. Ma la mente non è l'unica cosa che serve per questi enigmi, dovendo usare un pennarello spesso ci vorra precisione per disegnare bene gli elementi naturali da creare, per questo io consiglio di giocare con mouse e tastiera se lo avete su PC ma anche con gamepad è decisamente giocabile.
Le fasi platform sono parecchio facili e per quanto siano adrenaliniche, puntino sulla velocità e sul tempismo non ci vorrà molto a superare ognuna di queste fasi, sono più che altro un pretesto per rendere meno noiose i puzzle poichè la maggiorparte delle fasi platform sono dentro a degli enigmi. Il level design del gioco però si esprime al meglio solo nei puzzle che comunque contengono quasi sempre una parte platform.
La trama è semplicissima, senza infamie e senza lode ma non credo una trama complessa si sarebbe adattata al contesto.
Il gioco ha anche molti segreti/collezionabili che si ottengono risolvendo altri mini puzzle contenuti nel puzzle principale, sono tutti gradevolissimi comunque.
I checkpoint saranno frequentissimi rendendo meno frustrante il tutto. Peccato per alcuni bug nelle fasi finali non molto piacevoli ma niente che possa rovinare l'esperienza complessiva.

Ricapitolando:
       Pregi
-Level design incredibile
-ottima atmosfera
-difficoltà ben calibrata
-collezionabili interessanti
      difetti
-alcuni bug negli ultimi capitoli
       neutro
-musica carina ma non memorabile
-trama
-longevità media

Per me è un 9.5/10 anche perché da tutto quel che potrebbe dare per il tipo di gioco che è.    Consigliatissimo

24711052.review:
Max the Curse of Brotherhood est un jeu de plateforme bien sympathique qui avait su attiré mon attention dès sa présentation en 2013 au stand Microsoft (E3 + Gamescom). Mélant un gameplay original et un style graphique attachant,le jeu était resté dans un coin de ma tête (comme tant d'autres) durant pas mal d'année. Comme quoi une présentation simple et efficace d'un jeu, est plus utile qu'un bourrage de crâne venant des éditeurs de AAA pour qu'on achète leurs produits.  Après chacun se fera son avis sur la question. Mais elle a le mérite d'être pausée.

Reprenant une mécanique d'un jeu précédent (Max & the Magic Maker), The Curse of Brotherhood donne pas mal liberté aux joueurs, là où les plateformers on tendance a être restraint.  Aidé de 4 stylo magiques ( découvert tout au long de l'aventure), Max pourra dessiné comme bon lui semble les liens servant a raccrocher deux plateformes. Et même si la rejouabilité du jeu est faible, la mécanique est bien accueilli. 

Pour ce qui est de la durée de vie (succès inclus), compter environ 5 heures de jeu. En soi, seul l'obtention de certains yeux et succès sont compliqués . 

Un jeu agréable (aussi bien sur clavier que via manette) qui devrait contenter pas mal d'amateur de plateformes.

24284505.review:
-Здравствуйте, газета *Игры ИзПитера*, охарактеризуйте пожалуйста игру Max: The Curse of Brotherhood в 3х словах.
-Ну если быть немногословным, то: яркая, неординарная и запоминающаяся.
 Вот так бы я охарактеризовал Макса, если бы мое мнение было бы кому-то интересно=). А теперь коротко расскажу, вдруг кому понравится.
 Если смотреть, то игра яркая, красочная, но сделанная в обычном 3д, и как итог, ничего интересного в рисовке нет. Сюжет до одури банален, злой маг похищает брата ГГ и он отправляется на его спасение, попутно ему помогает какая-то беззубая, ой простите,  безумная! бабуля. Которая, как бы, помогает ему, но направляет прямиком на колья, лаву, в обрывы и в желудки всякой нечисти. Такой вот нехитрый у нас сюжет.
 А вот как платформер, игра предстает с хорошей стороны, необычное решение с волшебным фломастером, который рисует ветки, лианы, воду и пр., и помогает нашему Максу, выбраться из всяких хитрых и не очень передряг. Прыжки, бег, прыжки, бег здесь этот процесс не кажется таким унылым, благодаря фломастеру=) Игра сама по себе не сложная, чекпоинт на каждом углу, позволяет быстро перепройти нелегкий отрезок. Однако, если вы хотите получить все достижения, то придется попотеть, ибо пару раз мой пукан немного подгорел(когда неуспел, криво нарисовал, недопрыгнул и бла бла бла).
 Как итог, могу сказать, что Max: The Curse of Brotherhood довольно прикольный платформер, на который можно потратить свое время и не пожалеть. 
P.S.
- Здравствуйте, газета *Игры ИзЮпитера*, спасибо что залетали к нам во время вашего горящего пукана! :)

24053400.review:
Funny I should stumble on this game Max, since not long ago I had posted in a forum thread discussing games like Another World (Out of this World) and Heart of Darkness.   Everybody was wishing HoD would come to steam.  After playing this demo (and thank you whoever for putting a demo of this up and making it only $2.99 during the steam sale this year!!) I had to have it.  

Just over an hour play at this moment (I know, not enough for a proper review) I felt compelled to review it in hopes others will see it in time to play the demo and see how good it is.  The cartoonish visuals are excellent and feel familar to any fan of kid's animation.  Don't let that stop you though.  It starts casual but started to get tougher at about the 1 hour mark for me, in world 2.  My favorite thing might be the sound and specifically the voice work.  First rate!  Max is very vocal the whole way through and it adds enormously to the whole experience, along with the music.  

It's been years for me and HoD, so it's hard to properly compare the 2 games without going on an exhaustive hunt for the game disc.  But that game immediately came to mind while watching the opening cutscene.  Pretty sure it would have even if I hadn't been discussing that old game.  

Only slightly over an hour in and this is great fun in short doses.  Highly impressed.  But even at $2.99 play the demo first to see if the difficultly level is right for you.  It does start pretty easy.

22354636.review:
(본 평가는 굉장히 편파적입니다. 평가의 정확도는 다른 한글 평가들을 참조하시기 바랍니다.)

사실 '플래포머 게임'의 기본은 제대로 지킨 게임이다.

게임의 시나리오도 평범하지만 무난하고, 최적화가 엉망이라 렉이 잘 걸리긴 해도 그래픽도 이 정도면 나쁘진 않은 수준이다. 레벨 디자인 자체는 상당히 괜찮은데, 이 게임의 특성인 펜(아니면 크레용인지..)을 활용하여 바닥, 줄기, 뿌리 등을 만들어나가고 그렇게 만들어간 지형지물을 통해 게임을 풀어나가는 과정 역시 훌륭하다. 그 밖에 수집 요소들을 준비해둔 것 역시 플래포머의 기본 소양을 아주 잘 지켰고 말이다.

그러나 이 게임의 '조작감'은 단연 LIMBO 이상으로 최악을 달린다. 본인이 이 게임에 비추를 주는 이유도 단 하나, 조작감 때문. 조작이 제대로 안 먹히는데다가, 분명히 같은 상황에서 같은 조작을 했는데 결과가 다르게 나오는 경우가 상당히 많다. 고작 발판 하나 뛰어넘고 장애물 하나 피하는데에도 이 단점이 극명하게 드러난다. 거기다가 PC로의 최적화가 그다지 좋지 않은데, 이 좋지 않은 단점와 시너지를 일으켜 그야말로 최악의 조작감을 보여준다. 

참고로 일부 스테이지에는 '죽지 않고 클리어' 도전 과제가 걸려있다. 아마 이 도전과제가 걸려있는 건 "우리 게임의 거지같은 조작감을 몸소 체험해보세요! 거지같은 조작감으로 인한 분노를 몸소 체험해보세요!!"라는 개발사의 의지였는지도 모르겠다. 본인은 패드로 게임을 진행했었다만, 막상 키보드로 해도 이 조작감은 크게 달라지지 않을 듯 하다. 

다른 면에서 뛰어나거나, 혹은 괜찮은 수준을 보이는 게임이긴 하지만, '조작감'을 상당히 중요하게 여기는 본인으로써는 이 게임에 절대로 좋은 점수를 줄 수가 없을 것 같다. 물론 도전과제도 다 끝내지 않았으니 블로그에 리뷰를 쓸 일도 없겠지.

21848974.review:
In sieben Kapiteln und diversen Unterkapiteln gilt es als Max den eigenen Bruder Felix vor dem bösen Schurken zu befreien. Das Spiel besteht zum großen Teil aus Jump & Run Phasen und vielen Rätseln, die, je weiter man im Spiel fortgeschritten ist, immer schwerer werden. Um die Rätsel zu lösen hat man einen Stift zur Verfügung, mit dem man Felsblöcke, Wasser, Lianen, Äste oder Feuergeschösse zeichnen kann. Am Anfang nur die Möglichkeit Felsblöcke zu zeichnen, so ergibt sich zum Ende des Spiels die Gegebenheit fünf Stifte (alle Funktionen in einem Stift) einzusetzen, wodurch man auch mal länger über die Lösung eines Rätsels nachdenken muss. Manche Rätsel lassen sich recht einfach und schnell erledigen, andere wiederum benötigen etwas mehr Hirnschmalz. In jedem Level können sogenannte "Böse Augen" und meistens ein Geheimnis gesammelt werden - Erfolge in Sicht ;) Man kann auch jederzeit zurück in die einzelnen Level und fehlende Augen einsammeln.
Alles in allem hat mich das Spiel sehr gut unterhalten. Es ist mit dem Steam-Controller + Steam-Link spielbar, habe es selbst jedoch mit dem PS4 Controller auf dem TV gespielt und es hat super funktioniert. Die Grafik ist sehr liebevoll in 3D gestaltet. Von mir eine klare Empfehlung. Ein super Spiel für zwischendurch, wenn man mal keine Lust hat ein Far Cry oder Hitman zu zocken.

21569041.review: Do you remember when Andy lost his dog Whiskey 1998. in "Heart of darkness"? If you do you're probably not a kid any more. The time has come to take on another similar quest. This time you are going to save your annoying brother Felix. Max the curse of brotherhood is fantastic looking puzzle platformer for everyone from 6 to 106 years. It may look like a kids game but it is actually for everyone because of nicely dosed difficulty. Reminds me also of another game I adore -" Limbo". In the beginning it is a bit on a easy side and at the end it gets little bit hard. Most of the game is just right. It will take about 11 hours to complete 20 levels and that too is just right. Your only weapon (beside your wits) is magic marker with 5 magic abilities: ground elevation, branches, wines, air flow and flame balls. You use magic marker to resolve greatly conceived platform puzzles. Puzzles are just challenging enough for maximum joy without much frustration. As I come from 20 years of console gaming my default setup on Steam is Xbox 360 controller. It held it's own until the last segments of the game when it became impossible to control magic marker with speed and precision needed. Not to worry. When this occurs you grab your mouse for marker control and all is well again.You'll feel omnipotent with controller in one and mouse in another hand :-) Or just play on keyboard and mouse - maybe that is even better, I haven't tried. If you have any interest in this type of games buy this and enjoy. It is just as good as "Limbo" or "Heart of darkness".

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood, es un juego que me tiene enganchado, si los juegos de plataformas te gusta, este debe ser una compra si o si.

Aspectos positivos:
- En el aspecto gráfico, el juego es muy "bonito" con esto me refiero a que los escenarios y su ambientación es preciosa.
- La historia, aunque sea un juego de plataformas, tiene una historia, que para muchos es familiar.
- La música y escenografia, permite vivir una autentica aventura.
- El control del pincel, y poder utilizarlo como uno quiera.
- La dificultad, algunos puzle si que requieren algo mas de pensamiento.

Aspectos negativos:
- Poder utilizar el pincel, con mas funciones, seria quizas incluso mejor.

La verdad, el juego me tiene enganchado y no soy muy fan de las plataformas, asi que recomiendo darle una oportunidad y no os arrepentireis.
8/10

21249298.review:
Ein geniales Spiel! Ich hatte es eigentlich für meine Kids gekauft, aber die wären damit wohl nicht weit gekommen.
Max ist ein wahnsinnig gut gemachtes Jump'n'Run mit knackigen Rätseln. Nichts unlöbares, aber teilweise durchaus fordernd. 

STORY: Es geht um Max, der sich wünscht, dass sein kleiner Bruder verschwindet. Als dies tatsächlich passiert, folgt er ihm aus schlechtem Gewissen und muss einiges an Gefahren bewältigen, um ihn wieder zurück zu bekommen. Dabei wird eine seichte Story ziemlich gut erzählt.
Als besonderes Hilfsmittel dient Max dabei ein Zeichenstift, mit dessen Hilfe er Seile entstehen, Äste wachsen oder Plattformen erheben kann. Im Laufe der Geschichte "lernt" der Stift immer mehr Dinge zu kontrollieren und viele Rätsel erfordern das Zusammenspiel der einzelnen Komponenten.

GRAFIK/SOUND: Beides ist wunderbar aufeinander abgestimmt. Im Comicstil springt und hangelt sich Max über den Bildschirm, die Landschaft ist träumerisch und die Gegner von Max sind glaubhaft und richtig gut animiert. Der Sound passt sich absolut nahtlos ein, die Kommentare von Max sind zwar nur auf Englisch, aber auch, wer kein Englisch versteht, kann dem Spiel absolut gut folgen.

SCHWIERIGKEITSGRAD: Ich würde sagen, dass es mittel bis schwer ist. Wer schon den einen oder anderen Tomb Raider-Titel gemeistert hat, sollte keine größeren Schwierigkeiten haben. Es gibt keine unfairen Passagen, bei manchen Rätseln braucht man zwar mehrere Anläufe, aber insgesamt sind alle Rätsel gut und logisch lösbar.

DAUER: Ich habe mir ein wenig Zeit genommen, habe aber auch nicht ALLES zwingend gelöst, sondern mich hauptsächlich um die Story gekümmert. Wer es also genauso macht, sollte in etwa 11 Stunden durch sein, die Profis ein wenig schneller und die, die alle Achievements sammeln wollen, könnten bis zu 15 Stunden brauchen.

FAZIT: Für mich war es ein genialer Überraschungshit! Ich stelle mir nach einem Spiel oft die Frage: würde ich es noch einmal spielen nach einiger Zeit? Und die Frage kann ich ganz klar mit JA beantworten. Es hat viel Spaß gemacht und die 13 Stunden, die ich unterwegs war, um den kleinen Bruder zu retten, waren sehr kurzweilig und ich fühlte mich sehr gut unterhalten!

Ganz, ganz klare Kaufempfehlung und alle Daumen hoch!

+++ UPDATE +++
Inzwischen habe ich auch meinen 6-jährigen Sohn und meine 8-jährige Tochter an das Spiel gelassen und beide sind total begeistert. Das Spiel, das ja eigentlich eine Aneinanderreihung von Rätseln ist, fordert die beiden und sie feiern jedes gelöste Rätsel als Erfolg! 
Und bislang staune ich sehr, wie wenig Hilfe sie dabei brauchen, wenn sie zusammen über Möglichkeiten diskutieren, die jeweilige Situation bewältigen zu können.

Mehr als einen Daumen hoch kann man hier ja leider nicht geben, aber das ist das Spiel allemal wert!

Buen plataformas, que al final ha conseguido dejarme bien satisfecho. Al principio prometia, pero para el 2º y 3º mundo ya estaba pensando en la posibilidad de dejarlo a medias, porque se me estaba haciendo bastante tedioso andar con el rotulador repitiendo hasta la saciedad lo mismo. Afortunadamente, el juego va constantemente a mas, y del 4º en adelante me ha dejado muy buen sabor de boca, especialmente los 3 ultimos mundos, que son muy superiores a los primeros jugablemente.

Aunque nunca pense que diria esto, esperaba mas graficamente. En las imagenes de Steam me parecia increible como se veia, en plan pelicula de animacion. Al final el modelado principal esta muy bien, pero los escenarios flojean mucho, especialmente los primeros (sobretodo el 2º). Al igual que la jugabilidad, el juego alcanza su mejor aspecto visual conforme avanza. Las secuencias, como de costumbre en otros juegos consoleros, cantan muchisimo. Pasar de 1080p 60fps a 720p y 25-30 fps se nota una barbaridad


En definitiva, un muy buen plataformas. Sin demasiados alardes y con una propuesta ciertamente original.

21171703.review:
Fucking epic, man. The shit you will pull off in this game is exhilarating. The levels have great verticality, and the vine swinging, oh man that vine swinging. So much of it! And over many vast, vast expanses of open air. Whether it be climbing up the side of towers or plummeting over massive waterfalls, [i]you will have lots and lots of fun[/i]. 

The magic marker mechanic is fun, the highlight being branch+vine creation (and destruction - you can chop off branches/vines from their source to reach higher/lower places). It's the most flexible, figure-it-out-yourself of all the elements you can manipulate, versus the earth pillars, which are fun, but very specific and limited. The player movement controls are precise. You won't find yourself overstepping platforms very often. 

The dynamic camera definitely carries some of the epicness of the game, and it's still very effective in letting you see what you need to see. There were two moments when I wish, after zooming out to get a large view of a room, it would zoom in a little sooner so I could control my character with more precision, but it never caused any problems. Overall a great feature.

The tone of the game is silly and childish. The characters are very stock, but that doesn't detract from the experience at all. The voice acting and music are all good, and the art/scenery is nice. 

Not sure how long it took me to beat the campaign the first time, but overall it took me 14 hours to complete the story, grab all the collectibles, get all the achievements, and then go back and complete every level without dying (a really fun challenge - you even get little badges to show for it). The puzzles aren't exactly hard, but there were a couple that had me scratching my head for a couple minutes. It's definitely more constant satisfaction than frequent perplexity. You could argue that the game is shallow, in a "little investment of skill or emotion" kind of way, and that would be true for the most part, but there's nothing wrong with that, if you don't mind that kind of thing. It's an Indiana Jones, not a Moby Dick, and that's ok. 

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is great fun, epic, and satisfying. I look forward to replaying the game (and hopefully a sequel) in the future.

21165700.review:
Un bon ptit jeu de plateforme ce Max : The Curse of Brotherhood. 
Ayant découvert la franchise Max par ce deuxième volet ( Le 1er volet n'est plus disponible à la vente ), j'ai adoré le principe du stylo magique qui est clairement l'atout majeur de ce jeu . 
L'autre point fort c'est les graphismes qui sont très beaux , variés et très agréables à regarder. 
La dessus rien à redire le moteur Unity fait son boulot.
De plus accompagné de belles cinématiques on a l'impression de regarder un film d'animation à la Pixar. 
L'histoire ressemble à un film pour enfant avec Max un ptit garçon qui part à la poursuite de son frère qui été enlevé par l'horrible vieillard Moustacho et sa grosse bête dans un monde imaginaire qu'il a crée malencontreusement.
Aidé du stylo magique de la grand mère , il va donc tout au long du jeu traversé une série de plateformes ,d'énigmes et de monstres dans l'espoir de récupérer son ptit frère. 
La difficulté est relativement simple malgré des passages délicats. 
La durée de vie est relativement courte si on on trace tout droit (5-6 heures) sinon elle peut durer une dizaine d'heures si on prend le temps de faire tous les succés.
Au final ,si vous avez toujours votre âme d'enfant ce petit jeu de Press Play est fait pour vous .

20798331.review:
作为多年前《马克斯的神奇蜡笔》的续作，这款游戏无疑更给系列增添了一份光彩。3D的画面给整个游玩过程带来了非常好的体验，关卡数也非常的丰富
本作的重点在于冒险故事，也带有少量难度非常简单的解密，算是非常传统的冒险类游戏，很适合放松休闲。游戏内有很多闪光点，最棒的莫属于关卡设计，无论是陷阱机关还是解密都设计的很用心，在游戏的全程里我从未感到过一丝厌倦。不过不知道主角所进入的冒险世界为何如此险恶，主角的死法都非常多样化，但都有一个共同点就是——很惨...... 游戏为了让玩家有更流畅的体验，主角死亡后的复活点几乎都在原地，这并不能说是降低了游戏难度，因为游戏的难度本来就很低 +_+ ...... 场景设计也非常棒，毫不夸张的说，画面可以和《三位一体2》来同向比较。
本作的核心元素——神奇蜡笔与前作相比有了巨大的改变，随着冒险的进行，拥有了各种各样的新能力，和机关组合搭配的种种设计无不让我眼前一亮，只不过在线性的关卡里，利用蜡笔解开谜题的方法与前作相比，并不能有太多的变化，但两个游戏的本质都不一样嘛

总结：冒险类游戏的标准作品，轻松愉快，质量很高，打折时不要错过哦~~

On the plus side, it controls well, it looks pretty dang nice and the mechanics show quite a bit of creativity and ingenuity, especially towards the end of the game.

On the minus side, it kinda lacks... personality, maybe? None of the characters are particularly interesting, and the world itself could've been lifted from any one of a thousand children's bargain-bin cartoons.

20702337.review:
Nel perfetto matrimonio tra generi, platform e puzzle, qual'è Max: The Curse of Brotherhood, davvero poche sono le sbavature e, pertanto, è impossibile non parlare bene di questo gioco. Dopo aver spedito vostro fratello minore in una dimensione parallela, sarà compito vostro andarlo a recuperare dalle avvizzite mani del perfido Mustacho, che vuole usare il corpo ancora giovane di vostro fratello come suo prossimo contenitore: una trama per nulla originale, un puro pretesto per proseguire nel gioco, ma che saprà regalarvi qualche timida risata di tanto in tanto.

Il fulcro del gioco sarà il vostro pennarello magico, capace di creare rocce, liane, acqua e fuoco, in determinati e predefiniti spot, per superare i numerossissimi puzzle ambientali. La difficoltà di questi ultimi è ben bilanciata e difficilmente un enigma potrà risultare frustrante: gli unici momenti in cui potrebbe sopraggiungere la morte, saranno o quelli in cui il tempo rallenterà in seguito, ad esempio, alla rottura di una piattaforma, dove bisognerà essere rapidi nel trovare la soluzione; oppure nelle fughe che dovremmo sostenere, in cui velocità di pensiero ed esecuzione saranno obbligatorie per non essere divorati.

Menzione particolare per la realizzazione tecnica del titolo, realizzato sfruttando il versatile Unity Engine: davvero un bel palcoscenico di colori ed animazioni, il che rende MTCOB anche un videogioco molto bello da vedere, non solo da giocare.

Cheers...a Mighty Max!...ah no, non è lui...scusate, lapsus da vecchietto.

20636373.review:
THE PLATFORMING
I'm no Super Mario pro and I'm no casual gamer so this game was perfect for me. It's probably considered easy by platform addicts, I dunno. It had only one or two action/platforming moments which were really hard to the point I thought they were just bad by design (one of them was indeed as I saw Xbox and PS videos which showed how much easier it was on consoles).

THE PUZZLES
The puzzles are all really nice with varying difficulties. You get a lot of easy ones, a good amount of medium ones and the eventual hard ones just before the checkpoints. Which by the way are generously well spread. I loved that as I'm a gamer with a life (and kids and multiple jobs).


GREAT WITH KIDS
Oh yeah talking about kids. This game is great to play with your kids and teach them about physics and logic. I had a blast with mine.

SHOULD I GET IT?
Get this game if you like platformers and puzzles but if you are looking for a real challenge, this is not for you.

20566261.review:
The game LOOKS fantastic. The basic platforming is adequate. The real attraction of this game is the magic marker, which works SORT OF (very big emphasis on "sort of") like Okami in that it lets you draw things into reality that you can use to overcome obstacles.

The magic marker is an interesting idea that is not very interesting in execution. You can only draw lines when and where the game has predetermined that you are able to draw lines. And you have no control over the kind of thing that you draw, because the game decides that too. It is literally like the game saying, "Now you will draw a vine right here." And you do, because that's all you CAN do. That, in a nutshell, is how the magic marker works. Sometimes there are situations that are somewhat puzzling, but the game always gives away the solution by having the blabbermouth protagonist just flat out tell you how to do it.

The thing that really turned me off on it, though, and decide that I wasn't going to play it anymore, is the way the game spams the abitrary "think fast" type situations. I would have been fine playing it to completion if it were just a sort of platforming adventure with some magic marker puzzles. But as you are making your way through a level, the game likes to suddenly throw a random "think fast" hazard at you, where you have to figure out what you need to do to avoid the hazard in just a few seconds or die and go back to the previous checkpoint. These are made worse by the way the game hijacks and repositions the camera to show you the incoming hazard, so you are also disoriented in addition to needing to think fast. And there is an element of these "think fast" hazards being completely arbitrary, because sometimes the glowing objects you can use via your magic marker don't even APPEAR until the instant the "think fast" hazard appears. This results in most of these moments feeling ill-considered and frustratingly punitive. You know the kind. The trial-and-error, die-repeatedly-until-you-guess-what-the-developer-wants-you-to-right-here type of rigamarole. Apparently most players who picked up this title are cool with it, but it is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. I have very little tolerance for it.

In the end it is a beautiful looking game with adequate platforming, a draw mechanic that is an interesting idea but not very interesting in execution, and (in this player's opinion) a sorry overuse of arbitrary "think fast" moments and chase/forced-momentum sequences.

There is some good to be found here, but it just tends to overuse too many things that are not to my taste and completely turn me off, so I probably will not finish it.

Final verdict:

7) A classic, essential, and/or must-buy game that is worth full price.
6) A good game that is worth the full price.
5) A pretty good game worth checking out--especially if discounted.
4) A fairly good game, but I'd recommend buying it discounted.
[h1]3) Not great, but a few redeeming qualities. Only buy if heavily discounted.[/h1]
2) Only worth checking out if you are dangerously curious.
1) Avoid at all costs.

20416288.review:
Do una mia opinione su questo gioco dopo averlo completato al 100%.
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood è un gioco che unisce una certa componente platform con meccaniche di risoluzione di enigmi presenti in puzzle game. Impersoneremo Max, un ragazzino, che mosso dal senso di colpa dovrà salvare il proprio fratellino dopo aver aperto una porta dimensionale ed averlo fatto rapire da un mostro. Il Gameplay è estremamente facile ed intuitivo; dopo pohi minuti di gioco incontreremo un'anziana maga che, non essendo riuscita a sconfiggere il nostro nemico, ci fornisce un pennarello magico che dovremmo utilizzare per disegnare e risolvere alcuni enigmi e che nell'avanzare dei livelli aumenterà il suo potere. Per esempio potremmo modellare il terreno o disegnare ruscelli volanti, ecc. Gli enigmi sono la parte divertente del gioco, ben strutturati e variegati che, conditi da una buona fisica, vi faranno ragionare sul risolvimento lasciandovi una bella sensazione di soddisfazione. Graficamente il gioco presenta componenti cartonesche e fumettose molto ben disegnate, al primo impatto non direste che è stato sviluppato in Unity, molto appagante agli occhi. Eccezionale gestione della fotocamera, sonoro semplice ma coinvolgente.

CONCLUSIONI: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood è un gioco divertente e ben strutturato che riesce a coinvolgere il giocatore per tutta la partita. Ottimi enigmi, buona grafica ma per niente impegnativo. Consigliato a chi si vuole rilassare, a chi apprezza il genere ed a chi piace risolvere enigmi.

Un gioco da avere in Libreria, consiglio l'acquisto a tutti, magari sotto sconti festivi. Giocabile sia con Gamepad sia con Mouse e Tastiera.

VOTO: 7,5
