있는지도 몰랐던 게임 대기열 거르다가 알게 됨. 
세일 기간에 산 게 행운....
게임 컨셉도 명확하고 예쁜 그래픽에 레벨 디자인도 좋음. 
언어 장벽이 문제가 되지 않는 게임.
꼭 해보길!

==========================================

클리어 후 다시 쓴다
이 게임은 정말 압도적이다

시작할 때부터 3D 애니메이션 같은 느낌의 그래픽과 
배경, 캐릭터 컨셉 디자인으로 플레이어를 사로잡는다
아트 부분, 사운드 부분도 모두 매력적이고, 퍼즐의 난이도도 매우 깔끔하다
- 퍼즐이 무엇보다도 난해하지 않다는 점에서 더욱 그런 것 같다

필자의 노트북이 저가형이라는 걸 고려하면 최적화도 잘된 듯
- 필자 컴퓨터 사양 (intel HD 5500, RAM 4GB)을 기준으로 
어지간한 컴퓨터에서 무난히 돌아간다 

펜으로 오브젝트를 그려 퍼즐의 풀이 방법도 여러가지다
인디 작품에서 자주 발현되지 못하는 플레이어의 자유도가 드러나는 부분이다

스토리도 아기자기하며 플레이 타임도 인디 게임치고는 꽤 준수하다고 생각한다
대사가 그렇게 많지 않은 편이라 영어가 모국어가 아닌 
플레이어들도 95% 이상의 컨텐츠를 즐길 수 있는 게임이다

에필로그 스테이트도 만들어 한편의 애니메이션을 플레이한 느낌을 주고,
플레이하다 보면 알겠지만 - 메인 메뉴의 배경이 챕터를 클리어할 때마다 
현재 진행중인 챕터의 컨셉으로 변하는 디테일도 신경썼다

필자야 세일 기간에 샀다지만 제 값을 주고도 후회는 없을 듯한 게임이다
- 다만 한 게임으로 다회차 플레이를 원하거나 멀티엔딩 등의 요소를 원하는 플레이어라면, 
퍼즐 풀이가 자유롭던 뭐든간에 흐름 자체가 선형적 진행의 게임이기 때문에 
구매 전 다시 생각해볼 필요는 있겠다

9.0 / 10

20310234.review:
This will be a mixed review; by one side I am enjoying it (currently going through the second chapter) but by the other I cannot recommend it except for a very specific public, and at a discount price (about 5€, 14€ are excessive)

TL;DR: It can be summarized as a tablet game with superb graphics. Oddly enough, it seems that it would be best suited for touchscreens (you "draw" columns of rock, branches, etc. to advance) yet it appears it has always been a PC/Console game.

Pros:

* Graphics are very good for a platformer, both for character movements and for cutscenes.
* Movements are swift.
* Plot is simple, but ok.

Cons:

* Too simple: just keep moving, everywhere where you need to "draw" something is clearly visible in the game so you need almost no thinking.
* Control: you move with keyboard and, when you get to a place where you have to "draw" something, you have to position your mouse again. Not an issue when you are not in a hurry, but sometimes the baddies are pursuing you. As I said, this game would have made lots more of sense in a touchscreen.

So? If you find it discounted (5€-6€) and you sometimes like simple games to have some relaxing playtime, it may be a good purchase. If not, probably it is not what you are looking for.

20285943.review:
[h1]Tolles Jump n' Run im Stil animierter Filme[/h1]

Gestern habe ich dann mal "Max" gestartet, als ich wieder mal nicht wusste, was ich spielen sollte. (Man hat ja nix in seiner Bibliothek)
Also gehts los und das Spiel zeigt einem kurz und knapp im besten Dreamworks Stil, was es mit der Geschichte auf sich hat.
Der Bruder wird in eine Fantasywelt entführt und wir, als Max, springen hinterher um ihn zu retten.

Soweit so gut rennt und springt man durch wirklich sehr hübsch anzusehende Levels. 
Hin und wieder lockern kurze Zwischensequenzen die Springerei auf. 
Als "Waffe" erhält man eine Art Zaubermalstift mit dem man Dinge in die Welt malen sowie auch wieder zerstören kann. 
Das bringt eine kleine Prise Hektik mit ins Spiel, welche aber nie wirklich frustig wird, da die Speicherpunkte (es wird autom. gespeichert) meistens sehr gut gewählt sind.
Die Steuerung geht easy von der Hand und groß Tastenkombinationen muss man zum Glück nicht lernen.

Das Spiel ist eine tolle Abwechslung mit wirklich sehr hübscher Grafik, witzigen Charakteren und schönem Sound.
Ich kann es uneingeschränkt empfehlen.
Von der Spieldauer wird es relativ kurz sein. (Ich bin momentan bei knapp 5h und dürfte kurz vor dem Ende stehen)

Schönes, kleines, buntes Jump n' Run! :)

20012709.review:
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is a neat little platformer where the central character Max has to save his little Brother Felix from certain doom. The graphics and level design are both top notch and function very well with the magic abilities Max gains throughout his adventure. I especially liked the innovative way the core game mechanics have you 'draw' into the level to move stuff around and help Max.

I enjoyed every bit of it and even challenged myself to complete each level without dying. Secrets and achievements are very transparent and fair. The game indicates missed secrets and collectables. Playing with a controller was fun; cannot comment on keyboard + mouse.

If you're looking for a good game that isn't publicized like a AAA game, get Max: The Curse of Brotherhood :D

19781295.review:
Parádní puzzle plošinovka, ve které hráče čekají různorodé úchvatné lokace. V každé nové lokaci získá váš magický fix (Max a jeho bratr se nechtěně dostanou do pohádkového světa) jednu magickou vlastnost. V poušti budete zvedat plošinky, v džungli kreslit větve (libovolného tvaru - závisí na tom i hádanky) nebo liána, později si hrát s vodními víry. Později se při hádankách klasicky kombinuje vše naráz. Na hráči není na to přijít kde kreslit, dokonce ani co, protože barevná místa interakce jsou jasně vyznačena. Jde jen o to přijít na řešení. Jindy před něčím utíkáte a pomocí interakce si děláte cestu přes překážky, čili střídají se logické pasáže s těmi akčními.
I přes pomyšlení, že by se kreslení dělalo lépe na dotykovém displeji je hraní s myší snadné a přesné.
Max vypadá velice pěkně, zní pěkně a co víc, mluví pěkně. Dabing Maxe který výstižně a vtipně komentuje kdejaké dění.
Taková ta stará dobrá Pixarovka.

19766679.review: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood beklediğimden çok daha güzel çıktı. Oyunun grafikleri çok canlı tam bir platform oyununa yakışacak şekilde renkli. Bulmacaları ne çok zor ne de kolay hiç sıkmayan eğlenceli bir macera oyunu olmuş. Oyundaki en güzel olay da sihirli kalem. Bu kalemle yeri geliyor sarmaşık çiziyor karşıya atlıyor, yeri geliyor dal çiziyor uçurumdan geçiyoruz. İlerledikçe toprağa, suya ve ateşe bile etki ediyoruz. İlerledikçe bunları kombine bir şekilde kullanıyor ve küçük bulmacaları çözüyoruz. Eğlenceli bir macera oyunu arıyorsanız mutlaka bu oyuna şans verin.

19766219.review: Gioco semplicemente spettacolare! La storia oserei definirla più che ridicola, ma il punto forte di questo gioco è il gameplay. Infatti bisognerà risolvere degli enigmi tramite l'ausilio di un pennarello dai poteri "magici". Ciò che lo rende così bello è la varietà del gameplay e il continuo stupiri di fronte all'originalità degli sviluppatori che riescono a rendere il gioco davvero dinamico. 19721388.review:
Dear Potential Buyer, do you have a sibling? If yes, GET THIS GAME. JUST BUY IT. Ask questions later. If no, GET THIS GAME ANYWAY JUST BECAUSE.

Max is a wonderful game. I cannot recommend it enough. Its exhilarating and absolutely fun. I cannot stress enough how fun this game is.

It starts off pretty chill and mellow, allowing you to get a handle on things. You have an infinite about of chances to carry on from your previous self-saving checkpoint (which is throughout several places in the game) so you don't ever have to go back and redo and entire portion of the game itself, this also applies when you exit and re-enter the game. Once you get further into the game, your item (a marker) gets better and the puzzles become a lot more complex, but not too much that its frustrating. There's no 'one' way to solve a particular puzzle, sometimes you can just get really creative with it and see how far that gets you.

YOU HAVE A MAGIC MARKER WHICH AIDS YOUR QUEST. A MAGICAL MAGIC MARKER! DO YOU NOT UNDERSTAND THE HIDDEN PUN IN THIS GAME? Bloody hell. I love this idea of an actual magic marker. You're going to love it as well, it gets the neatest little upgrades as your progress and you even use it as a flashlight ._.

The controls are simple af, its so simple that you can actually play this on your laptop, with your touchpad and you'd still manage through this game without much of a sweat. Additionally, the graphics are amazing and it flows so well. Its like you're in a little cartoon with such an interesting plot!

That's not to say that this game is easy peasy. Going through this, the game makes having fun more important than the difficulty of challenges. Most you will find easy af while others will take some time (and dying) to get through.

I could go on forever about this game, but fear not! I won't. I snagged this game while it was on sale and its something I will never regret (and I am picky af when it comes to games). Its definitely worth getting. Even if you're not into platformers, I can guarantee that this game will leave you feeling satisfied. Give it shot. You won't regret it.

19476764.review:
SO. MUCH. FUN! 

One of the reviews here said that if one enjoyed Tomb Raider, one would enjoy this title as well. I bought this game based on that review and I have to say, this has got to be one of the my favourite platformer games. 

The gameplay is fun, unique and exciting. You have a magic pen that you can use to transform your environment into a platform for you to interact with and to help you on your journey to find your brother. I thought it would be awkward to try and draw things on screen with the controller, but I was wrong. It was easy and intuitive, one element that I enjoyed about the game.

+ Fun little puzzle-platformer.
+ Pretty graphics (like watching a cartoon).
+ Predictable but still enjoyable story.
+ Puzzles are mostly not too easy (though this could be a con for a kid).
+ Great voice acting.
+ Very forgiving checkpoints.
+ Tight controls.
+ Very well paced.

- Final boss fight is too short and too easy.
- Linear (though for this type of game, it is sort of expected).

I seriously hope there's a sequel. Would buy it in a heartbeat.

My Rating: 9/10

19461440.review:
M A G I C O. 

Vi sembrerà di vivere una storia della Pixar. Gag esilaranti, colorato e con una storia davvero piacevole che non vi darà a mancare anche dei buoni colpi di scena sul finale. Le ambientazioni sono sempre varie e il level design è fatto in modo che seppur sia un platform non risulti mai monotono. Una delle cose che ho apprezzato di più nel lato del gameplay è stata la fisica, davvero ottimizzata in un modo grandioso. Difatti la risoluzione di diversi enigmi non porta ad una scelta giusta o sbagliata ma ad un sistema risolutivo molto più grezzo e casereccio, ovviamente in senso positivo. Ciò rende il tutto decisamente più immersivo. 

Parlando della longevità che dire. Sulla grande linea delle 10 ore massime lo avrete completato al 100%. Ma è assolutamente un bene, difatti il gioco da il massimo fino alla fine senza esser mai ripetitivo e monotono. Però è un giusto avviso in caso lo vogliate comprare scontato. (In periodo di saldi circa 2.70)

18921536.review:
通关撒花：麦克斯兄弟魔咒，解救熊孩子弟弟的奇幻之旅。

其实早在几年前，本作的前代：麦克斯与魔法标记就已经出现在玩家的视野当中了，别具一格的游戏方式、乍看起来简陋的画面、如同蜡笔画一般粗糙的质感，带来的却是无穷无尽的游戏乐趣。

那么到了今天，本作在画面上有了质的飞跃，配合着3D的效果，某些场景竟然不逊色于某些大作。解谜要素、动作要素结合的更精妙了，五种颜色的画笔，如何帮助主角救出他的弟弟？尤其是到了后期，弟弟被关在球形笼子里，哥哥如何带球逃生？这需要玩家强大的操作能力和天马行空的想象力。

介绍一下画笔：
1、橘黄色，可画出平台，能提前站在位置上，平台会带着主角一路高升。
2、深绿色，可画出树枝，除了铺路之外，更重要的是可以脱离，作为道具出现，但只能用一次。
3、浅绿色，可画出藤条，主角可以利用它荡到高处，注意：藤条和树枝的组合是很常见的，藤条可以系在树枝上，切断树枝之后就是加长的藤条。
4、蓝色，可画出水流，强大的冲刷能力可以带着主角一飞冲天，还有一个效果是对岩浆进行冷却，把它变成暂时可以落脚的平台，但时间有限。
5、紫色，可发出炮弹，后期用来攻击敌人，在距离不够时，可以先将附近的树枝转化为紫色，同样可以发出炮弹。
能够使用画笔的地方都有闪光，每一处都有用，全局观也很重要。

关于最终BOSS：
除了必要的躲避之外，要爬到两端的高台上做好准备工作。在他准备用手推主角的时候用炮弹打手，准备喷毒液的时候用炮弹打脸，其他时间无法攻击。最后将头上的两个角捆住，就大功告成。过程比较长，需要高度集中。

本作的操作难度相当高，如果选择手柄进行游戏，画笔就很难控制，从第四章开始，都是要在几秒钟内完成画笔操作的同时主角不能停顿，容错率非常低。当然，使用键盘和鼠标会容易些，但是这类游戏的操作手感，手柄才是最棒的。

推荐一个人控制手柄一个人控制鼠标来进行游戏，当然对自己操作很自信的玩家也可以单独挑战一下这款游戏，绝对是不一样的感觉。

18394908.review:
I'm suprised Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is not widely mentioned, as it is fun little game.

It's supposed to be a sequel to Max and the Magic Marker, which I didn't play. But it is not a big loss. Out of couriosity I checked the other game on YouTube and my conclusion is, that developers where toying with the idea before delivering the real deal which is Curse of Brotherhood. And I'm suprised it didn't get the hype and reach as wide as Ori and the Blind Forest, as both are released by Microsoft studios.

The kid named Max, who got rid of his brother via magic spell that he found on the internet. His brother Felix is captured through portal into another wolrd and Max jumps right after him realizing the consequences of his action. From now on you control Max, who get to use a magic marker. A simple item that let's you solve the puzzles throughout the game mixed with platforming. The marker allows you draw rock pillars, branches, lianes, water geysers at certain spots leaving you to figure out how to do it to proceed further or solve the puzzles. Not all of it will be available from the beginning, but as it is straight-forward side-scroller, there won't be any backtracking.

Now, I need to mention that I play with my X360 controller and I have no idea how the game works with keyboard control. As for the gamepad it felt very smooth, both for controling Max and drawing stuff with the marker. Smooth and nice graphic won't obscure anything and light tutorial won't leave you clueless as to how to interact with objects. You will be able to draw Os from branches, cut them by the base and use it as an object you can climb onto. Some enemies apart from hazzards also serve as a solution to the puzzle. You also have to combine marker's abilities. All of that is explained in the game so you know how, but thankfully doesn't serve as a guide. The difficulty of the puzzles is various however. Normaly you'll be able to go through with very brief moments of reflection. Sometimes you may be stuck for longer, but never long enough to make you frustrated. Colorful and childish theme of the game may suggest it is for younger players and I encourage them to try it.

There are collectibles in the game, but they serve no other purpose, than to chill your eventual OCD. There are evil eyes to collect and these may be placed in the areas that will take you longer to figure acces to. There are also pieces of the amulet of the Old Lady (she's kinda guiding you through the magic land), much harder to get. The main problem with it, is that the camera is very stiff and concetrated on Max. Sometimes you may be able to spot evil eye somewhere on the corner of the screen, but getting some of them requies leap of faith. 

The artstyle is simple but gorgeous, there is also superb voice-acting, a bit unexpected from a small game. Normally I play on my PC connected to 32" LED TV so I can enjoy the graphics of such colorful games. However, considering the overall quality of the graphics it shouldn't struggle on older gear, but it does. I own 8GB RAM Laptop with 1GB RAM graphics card and quad core processor and had huge problem with cutscenes. I got the sound without visuals or got it with miserable framerate. No struggles on a PC, though.

As Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is puzzle-platformer, have in mind it will play different than a straight-forward platformer. It is not very demanding game, there's a free demo available on Steam, that I would reccomend to try out first before buying the full game. It was fun for me.

7/10

Any downvotes I get are probably deserved because this is not a bad game overall, but I don't care because I just can't force myself to endure much more because it is just pure 100% trial and error, so it's basically just like watching a boring adventure game. There is no challenge, once you die then see how something is done then you should get it nearly 100% of the time on your second try. Also, checkpointing is some of the worst I've ever seen mainly because I don't think there is any. I had to exit the game to leave home then later came back and started up the game and had to redo an entire tedious level that personally I never wanted to see again, ever. It was just not fun in the slightest bit to have to do it again and I just felt super p-ssed off, and neither is a automated trial and error journey. If there is checkpointing in later levels, you would never know it because the game never shows a saving checkpoint icon like all other games do, so it's one of those "well I better not exit the game or quit until I finish the entire tedious level" type of games. I'm pretty sure levels have no checkpointing, but who cares.

If it weren't like a Disney kids movie, I might play it some more. Then again probably not because of no checkpointing. Levels aren't horribly long, but with boring, automatic-win tedious levels with a seen it done before already drawing mechanic, I just can't force myself to care because it keeps putting me to sleep. Much more fun platformers exist if you look. They are more fun because they are infinitely more rewarding than this.

I gave it a thumbs up because like I said at the beginning it is not a bad game mechanically, just mind numbingly tedious. I can't wait for each level to be over. zzzZZZzzzZZZ...

18101139.review:
Max.  You little pleasing title you.  Sometimes, during a steam sale, I grab something that looks interesting and just hope it pans out.  This game looked nice. Puzzley platformifisizing and all that.  Figured, why not it's only $3.75.  What a fantastic surprise.

If you are like me and tend to gravitate to action platforming a la Prince of Persia and Tomb Raider as well some some puzzling going on then this very well might fit in your library quite snuggly.

Max's brother is abducted by an evil villain named Mustachio - WARNING:  This title is very anti-mustache and any facial hair aficionados might be offended.  His lil bro is then sucked into a netherworld from which only Max can save him.  I don't know why.  If it was *my* little brother I would be turning his room into a new play room and stealing all his legos.  But I suppose brotherly love must overcome and all that.

Off the bat you'll encounter some tutorials on drawing with your mouse or controller.  Yep, I know it sounds bad, right?  But it's actually pretty easy. I even did it entirely with my controller.  You solve puzzles by drawing vines, branches, water spouts, exploding fire, earth columns, and probably some other stuff I have totally forgotten by now.  These things you draw not only to solve puzzles but also to make up the framework for the platforming.  The puzzles are good, some even causing me to say "what the..".  While being somewhat casual a few  will actually stump you for awhile.  Now, the  platforming is on the medium level until level 6 where is bumps up to a bit-more-than-medium, the majority of the tougher bits towards levels 5 and 6.  And it's done well, usually with a giant monster chasing you.  Very action oriented and guess what?...you have to solve puzzles on the fly while being chased by an evil monster and timing the platforming.  YES.  It's that type of game.

Is it hard?  Before level 5 it is fairly casual gamer friendly.  Level 5 requires more brain activity and Level 6 requires some quick maneuvering.  The final boss is hardish, but once you figure out what to do it's a piece of cake.  Hardness...7/10.  For an extra challenge there are some artifacts and eyeball spy camera plants to uproot.  I got some of those, but frankly my steam library is too damn big to try to 100% a lot of games. Time management yo.

Graphics are sorta kinda Pixar looking. They look great and run well.  I would not say it was stunning, but definitely pretty.  Had zero crashes using a few PC's and ran pretty well overall at 60 FPS with a mediorce system.  Sounds are well done and the menus are easy to navigate.  Save spots are set in good places, and I have to say it was a wonderful produced game all in all.

If you like action puzzle platformers, then give this a go.  Wonderful title and quite enjoyable.

18048556.review:
This is a fun little game! You play as Max, who is trying to find his brother, wielding a magic marker with the power to create and manipulate objects in this puzzle-platformer. It's a mix of untimed puzzles, plus ones you have to do (sometimes literally) on the fly. Some of the puzzles require split-second timing where you're being chased, but parts that are super time-sensitive go into a slow-motion for a few seconds to allow you to quickly analyze the situation and act appropriately. They are (usually) very generous with checkpoints, so even if you're not so good at the platforming aspects (like me), you won't have far to go when you have to repeat a level. The magic marker mechanic is really well done, with you being able to adjust the height of pillars for jumping on, create different shapes out of branches for either jumping on or chopping down and using for other purposes, vines for swinging and climbing, water jets where you get to decide their path, and goodness, gracious great balls of fire for blowing up enemies and barriers.

Pros:
+ Good Music
+ Good voice acting (I seriously felt bad for Max when he jumps into lava and screams in genuine agony)
+ Good art (it has characters with a Jimmy Neutron feel but with great backgrounds)
+ Novel mechanic (drawing/manipulating objects)
+ Collectibles for added challenge
+ Puzzles took thought but were not brain-breaking

Neutral:
~ Decent length, though I would have liked more. I got 11 hours out of it, including my bad platforming skills and a lot of redos, and finding all the collectibles. So, not super short, but I would have loved more.

Cons:
- The marker is not always at the ready, making it feel sluggish sometimes as you have to wait for it to appear for use. This doesn't affect the actual game play, since it's created with the sluggishness in mind, but it's a tad annoying at times. Likewise, the effect of your marker (e.g. lifting up a platform) doesn't always keep up with how fast you make it, with a similarly sluggish feel. Not a deal-breaker, since I still played the game to completion, including collectibles, but it was annoying.
- This is not a con for me, but maybe for others: The puzzles aren't maddeningly difficult, as some people may prefer. A lot of the difficulty comes from the split-second timing, but the untimed puzzles take at most a few minutes to puzzle out.

Overall: 9/10. Would replay.

18027132.review:
A very pretty game, with a colorful and enticing universe. It's a platformer with a good atmosphere and some imagination. It's rather on the 'casual' side: it's very varied and not too difficult, which will make you feel like you're good at this game.

Graphics: Great. Sometimes you feel like you're into an animation movie.

Physics: Great. All objects behave, move and fall like you'd expect: boulders, vines, branches, roots, water and jets, ...

Game mechanics: Good. You change objects from the scenery with your magical pen to reach your objectives (progress through a level, block enemies, succeed in an impossible jump, ...) You can only do so starting at a few select spots in every level.

Gameplay: Good. It's dynamic, the setting changes often, so you'll have to find new ways to deal with the new challenges, and it's never feels repetitive or boring.

Story/Dialogue/Voice acting: Good (nothing to write home about, but good)

Level design: good to great (some good ideas, lots of imagination in some areas).

Difficulty: never too difficult (At most you'll retry a couple of times before overcoming an obstacle, when you die you lose less than a minute of progression).

Length: Short (about 7 hours to reach the end, a bit more to find all secrets in all levels). The progression is rather fast, so you'd have traveled a long way at the end of the game.

All in all, a good game that kept me wanting for more to the very end.

18018484.review:
Nice little platformer which I very much enjoyed. 

The game reminded me about the cartoons that I used to watch as a kid, and I was actually quite impressed with how well the developers managed to carry this theme through. The game basicly nailed it, everything from the very basic storyline, the hero and the villain, the dumb evil forces, the big monsters, along with some very convicing voice acting, cartoony graphics, and its very fitting music.

The game itself wasn't super hard, but it wasn't easy either. I am by no means a expert at platformers, and I am sure a lot of people would manage to get through the game with less deaths than I did. The game can be enjoyed by people of all ages, although younger kids might have a hard time at certain points in the game. I personally played the game with a controller, so I can't really speak for how it plays on a keyboard, but I found the controls easy to learn, and even the magic marker was easy getting used to.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
+ The magic marker added some very interesting mechanics to the game, that certainly made me think.
+ Good pacing of the game, with new mechanics being introduced through out the entire game.
+ Lots of checkpoints, which is nice for people who are horrible at platformers like me.
+ Achievements, and in-game collectables, which adds some replayability to the game.
+ Most cinematics can be skipped, which is nice for a second playthrough
+ The art style, the music, the cinematics, and the voice acting, all matched each other and was very well carried through. Which made for a very good experience. 

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- The game has certain parts that require some fast thinking, and change of controls. This means that the game wont be playable for everybody, and that younger kids might not have a fun time. The many checkpoints however helps a great deal with this, so you will rarely have to start all over again, in case you die.

18012223.review: Really clever platformer with some brilliant ideas and tricky gameplay.

17990250.review:
it's a 2.9D puzzle platformer, and the best-looking environments that I have ever played in. 

2.9D? Well, it's a 2D platformer, rendered in full 3D, wiht a rotating camera the changes angle slightly depending on the scene, and it renders beautifully. I genuinely wish I had a 3D Screen of some kind to try this out with. Often times you will see a path leading off here or there, and you feel like you should be able to follow them, but they are no in the 2D space, and are purely cosmetic... awwww.

It's a great looking game, it has a fairly simplistic, yet entertaining story line, it is just long enough that you can enjoy the immersion, yet don't get bored of the game or it's mechanics, and it has a few secrets that temp you to replay levels to find them.

None of the puzzles are so difficult that you will need to look upa guide - at least I ddin't have to, I just had to sit there and think about it for a minute. I think there were about 5 puzzles that wern't immediately obvious, and 2 of them actually had boxes that you could use, but they looked like part of the environment. (just a quick heads-up). Also, a couple of the secrets you only realise are there because you fall/die and see them on the way down. There are many 'no return' areas, too - where once you go through this door, it slams behind you, or a moster wrecks the path, or you slide/fall and can't go back. So make sure an area is clear before you carry on.

Voice acting is well done, story is simple, cute, but servicable. the magic marker can be a little hard to control on th eodd occasion, and it got me killed once or twice, but nothign that I would shoot the Dev's grandmother over :- ) Checkpoints are very forgiving.

Great little game to burn a  few hours in.

17977822.review:
[h1] Max: The Curse of Brotherhood - Adianta Jogar?[/h1]

[b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] é um jogo animado de gênero Plataforma em 2,5D recheado de puzzles. O jogo foi desenvolvido e distribuído em conjunto com a Press Play e Microsoft Studios disponível para PC, Xbox360 e Xbox One.

[h1] Enredo [/h1]
A aventura começa com Max chegando em seu quarto tendo seus brinquedos espalhados por seu irmão caçula, Felix. Ele então busca no [i]Giggle[/i] como se livrar de seu irmão mais novo (algo que o Coragem faria ^^). Então após falar a magia um portal se abre e uma mão peluda pega Felix. Max, então, entra no portal para tentar resgatar seu irmão. E é aí que o jogo começa. 
O portal o leva diretamente a um deserto e logo de cara ele vê Felix nas garras de uma monstro gigantesco. Ao perdê-lo de vista, Max avista uma árvore enorme onde vinhas (cipós), galhos e jatos de água são formados do nada. Ao subir completamente a árvore, Max se depara com uma velhinha que fala o porque desse mundo estar assim e o motivo do rapto de Felix. Para ajudá-lo, ela torna seu marcador de texto (chamado por mim de caneta) em um objeto mágico que o ajudará até chegar a fortaleza do vilão o Mustacho (quase mustache = bigode).

[Informação Extra] Poucos sabem, mas [b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] é o segundo jogo dessa série. O primeiro intitulado [b]Max & the Magic Maker[/b] (2010) é um jogo com as mesmas ideias básicas: desenhar para resolver puzzles. Nesse primeiro jogo, Max faz um desenho de um monstro com uma caneta mágica que toma vida e sai por aí tocando o terror. Max então se vê na obrigação de corrigir esse problema. Este porém nem chega aos pés da experiência que [b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] oferece.

[h1] Trilha sonora [/h1]
A trilha do jogo é um de seus pontos mais positivos. Cada situação tem sua música, cada cenário também. O som ambiente é ótimo, aliado com a qualidade gráfica, você se sente vendo um filme.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
A Física do jogo é boa até onde se pode comparar. Bugs são bem raros, mas ocorrem.

Quanto aos controles/movimentação, Max pode pular, correr, andar agachado, arrastar objetos, pendurar-se em vinhas e escalar, além de diversas outras ações possíveis com a caneta.
Em uma primeira gameplay, o jogo deve levar em torno de 4-5h para ser concluído, sendo que os 100% levam bem mais indo para  ~10h. (Se quiser ir atrás das conquistas, se prepare para repetir trocentas vezes ^^).

Os puzzles do jogo não são complicados, mas a execução muitas vezes leva muitos minutos para ser obtida. (Sem contar as vezes que a marcação do pilar laranja fica escondida.)

[h1] Gráficos [/h1]
Olha, desde o início do jogo eu vivia esperando surgir um "Pixar" na tela! Muito boa a animação, as cores, os traços, tudo contribui para nesse quesito o jogo seja bom.

[h1] Custo-Benefícío [/h1]
O jogo está R$27,99 como preço de base, mas eu o comprei em promoção por R$7,00. 
Se jogos platarma de ação/aventura lhe agradam, então [b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] deve estar pelo menos em sua LISTA DE DESEJOS. No preço normal, pode sair meio elevado, mas mesmo assim, pelo conjunto da obra ADIANTA JOGAR.

[h1] Comentários Finais [/h1]
Um jogo simples, mas com uma ambientação espetacular, com animação de ótima qualidade e com diversão garantida.

NOTA 9.0/10

dürfte / konnte (whatever, schaut einfach mal bei Google nach).

Der Umstand, das Microsoft nun die Rechte an "Max and the Magic Marker" besitzt haben dann
auch dazu geführt, das "Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" eigentlich als exklusive Titel für die Xbox Konsolen
erschienen ist was mich damals ziemlich verärgert / gefrustet hat.


"Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" ist ein grafisch sehr schön anzusehendes Spiel, das hin und wieder
Effektvoll die Perspektive verändert um zum Beispiel ein Rätsel / Puzzle in seiner vollen Größe zu zeigen.
Zwischen den Jump & Run und Rätsel Passagen werden immer wieder kurze aber schön anzusehende
Comicartige Videosequenzen eingespielt die, die Geschichte weiter erzählen und sich dabei gut in den
Spielfluß integrieren, leider sind alle gesprochenen Texte nur auf englisch verfügbar, optionale Untertitel
gibe es aber u.a. auch in deutscher Sprache.

"Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" spielt sich selbst auf einem Windows XP Rechner super flüssig ohne 
Leistungseinbrüche (getestet auf einem alten XP System mit einer 9500 Nvidia Karte und 3 GB Arbeitsspeicher).

Wenn man den Vorgänger nicht kennt, kann man "Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" vorbehaltlos empfehlen,
man sollte nur keinen Mario Klon erwarten, Max springt nicht auf die Teilweise recht putzigen Gegner drauf und beseitigt damit ein potenzielles Hinderniss, bei Max muss man die Umgebung und den magischen Stift dazu
benutzen um die verschiedensten Probleme zu lösen.

Im vergleich zum Vorgänger wurde die Grafik natürlich mächtig aufgewertet, was optisch einiges hermacht, leider bin ich als Max Fan etwas entäuscht über die Funktion des magischen Sift Werkzeugs, das hat mir im Vorgänger um einiges
besser gefallen.

Bei "Max and the Magic Marker" hat man zwar nur "einen" Stift, dafür darf man diesen aber auch tatsächlich wie einen Stift benutzen, was im Klartext bedeutet, man kann Problemlösungen im Vorgänger tatsächlich zeichnen, wenn man im Level glaubt eine Treppe ist die Lösung malt man eine Treppe, oder eine Leiter wenn man etwas kreativer sein möchte, malt man statt dessen z.B. eine Wippe, stellt Max auf die eine Seite dieser Wippe und malt über der anderen Seite über der Wippe ein Gegengewicht (das kann ein Stein, ein Auto, whatever sein), es kommt  nicht darauf an was man malt sondern welche Masse der gemalte Gegenstand hat und aus welcher Höhe man diesen Gegenstand auf die von Max gegenüber liegende Seite der Wippe trifft da hier ein Physikbasierendes System ala Crayon benutzt wird.

Bei "Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" gibt es stattdessen mehrere Stifte, mit denen man z.B. Felsten aus dem Boden hebt, Ranken wachsen läßt oder fliesendes Wasser in die Luft malt... das alles macht wirklich Spaß, nur war Teil 1
hier für den Spieler kreativer.

Am Ende, kann ich "Max: The Curse of Brotherhood" aber jedem Empfehlen der ein wirklich hübsches, kurzweiliges Puzzle Jump & Run spielen möchte.

17962408.review:
Very nice game. I love how it's so similar to Trine. The beautiful graphics really makes you appreciate the game a lot. At $3.75, I think it was worth okay. It took me 5 hours to complete the game so it didn't really hit the $0.50 per hour mark.

PROS
1. Graphics
Fantastic. I love the foreground/background effects. E.g. The Monster carrying Felix away.

2. Water Streams
Loved it. Like a water log ride at the amusement park except in all directions. I would have loved more long water stream combos.

3. Puzzles
Some of puzzles got me stumped for a while or made me assume it was supposed to be done some other way. It was extremely fun and funny to pause on a kid's game.

4. The Monster
I don't know why. It seems to resemble the monsters from Critters, yet I loved it. Too bad it died in the lava.

CONS
1. Missing Reappearing Marker
The marker automatically disappears the moment you start moving and reappears the moment you pause. This on and off behaviour is very annoying as it makes it hard to gauge the marker's appearance.

2. Collecting Amulet/Eyes is Worthless
It's just an achievement. You don't even get anything impressive. It's not even for more fun.

3. Incomplete Story?
When the game ended and I saw the concept ideas, I was surprised to see dragons, underground lairs, gear movements, Smile Town residents and even strange forest critters. They looked great and I was hoping to see them within the game. Not having them gave me a feeling of missing out on so many interesting things that the developer could be doing.

17337275.review:
​De início pensei que Max: The Curse of Brotherhood fosse uma cópia de Giana Sisters, pelo gráfico e pelo início da história (um monstro através de um portal captura o irmão, e o outro precisa salva-lo).
​Mas a semelhança para por ai.
​
​Max conta com puzzles variados, que são bem simples, mas que em alguns momentos podem te fazer pensar um bocado.
​
O jogo oferece uma boa jogabilidade no controle, já no teclado e mouse não achei assim tão boa, mas acredito que isso possa ser questão de gosto pessoal.
​
​O jogo também conta com itens escondidos, que te dão um motivo para explorar mais as fases.
​
​A única coisa que não me agradou muito, é o fato da caneta (a ferramenta que usamos para os puzzles) ser sempre limitada a quantidade de "tinta" que o puzzle precisa, impedindo que você possa viajar e criar soluções mais elaboradas.

17117705.review:
Не понимаю почему игру так хвалят? 96% положительных отзывов!
Max: The Curse of Brotherhood - очень скучная игра, "с сюжетом высосаным из пальца" и легкими головоломками.
Какие плюсы у игры? Их мало но они есть)
Геймплей, да да именно он самый главный плюс этой игры. Ничего подобного я не видел, нам прийдется при помощи маркера рисовать разные обьекты (лианы, палки, возывшенности из глины)
Графика, я не графодрочер, но скажу сразу графика радует глаз.
Теперь пройдем к минусам
Дизайн уровней, когда я проходил одну из локаций из-за немного не продуманных уровней и туповатой камеры я застревал на одном месте по 20 минут и не знал, куда дальше идти! Да и другие локации оставляют желать лучшего. Особенно там, где есть эти надоедливые стветлячки!
Музыка, да музыка вообще не впечатлила, сделали "абы как"
Сюжет, начинается все с того, что старшому брату надоело терпеть младшего и он заходит в аля Гугл, и пишет в строку:"Как избавится от младшего брата"После чего он находит заклинание, конечно же прочитывает его и младшего засасывает в портал, и старший успевает запрыгнуть в портал тоже. Согласитесь, начало эпичное =D Полсе чего, они оба оказываются в другом мире, только старший на свободе, а младший в заточении у какого-то усатого дядьки и естественно мы будем спасать нашего младшего брата. Сюжет просто каламбур, кому кому, но детям он понравится.
Оценки:
Геймплей: 8 из 10
Графон 7 из 10
Звук 5 из 10
Сюжет 3 из 10
Итог 5,5 из 10
Кому я рекомендую данную игру? Конечно же детям до 12 лет, им то точно понравится эта сказка, остальным же порекомендую пройти мимо, так как альтернативы есть! И это Ori and the Blind Forest и Rayman Legends, а для более взрослой аудитории я порекомендую Valiant Hearts: The Great War.

Вы будете плакать от боли, когда в 20й раз не сделаете нужной вам формы деревянное изделие, чтобы пробраться через светлячков.

16957020.review:
Jeu sympa. Ambiance allant de moyenne (extérieur) à très bonne (sous-terre et intérieurs). Scénar quasi-inexistant et pourvu d'aucune créativité (intro pompée sur Labyrinth et quête héroique basique avec grand méchant moustachu).
Voix de Max et son frère un peu crispantes quand on a besoin de refaire le même passage 5-6 fois. La mécanique de jeu est son avantage principal : elle répond bien et permet des énigmes variées quoi qu'un peu répétitives. Les réflexes ont cependant tendance à devenir plus importants que la réflexion (et donc les commandes un peu plus hasardeuses)  à mesure que l'on avance dans le jeu. Mes moments préférés (et détestés en même temps) sont les courses et les arrêt sur énigmes qui sont tout de même particulièrement cool, satisfaisants et pleins d'adrénaline.

Je recommande si vous avez envie d'un jeu de platerformes/réflèxes sans prétention avec une mécanique relativement originale et que le manque de créativité autre ne vous dérange pas.

“我想要我的弟弟消失啊啊啊！！！”

“哦，真的吗，那如你所愿。”

“哦艹你谁啊！我TM开玩笑的！”

“哦艹，我已经把他给怪♂叔♂叔了，你自己去救他吧！”

“哦艹，啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊”

于是神笔马良开始了他的千里寻弟之路。

优点：①[strike]可爱的哥哥和弟弟，可爱的背景，连反派都是各种可爱呢！（虽然杀主角的时候不可爱）[/strike] 卡通讨喜的画面，主角调皮的与老婆婆可爱腹黑的配音，狗血搞笑的剧情。

②新颖的神笔设定让人可以发挥奇思妙想来各种姿势过关，难度适中的解密，不难但是也要细心找找的收集要素。

③存档，继续存档都很人性化，bug我是没遇到过。

缺点：①画笔的操作略蛋疼，有时候有延迟，有时候抢时间就容易心急。。。[spoiler]哥哥的运动神经也是各种不科学，各种极限运动都不带喘气的（游戏罢了你在纠结个啥）[/spoiler]

②各种能力的画笔是随着剧情获得的，然而剧情很短，最后一个火画笔得了还没多久就结局了(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻

除了有意思画笔之外各种被三位一体按在地上摩擦的作品，建议能低价入就尽量低价，休闲的时候拿来玩玩还是不错的。

阿汪评分：横版过关类68/100亮点不多的小品作 不推荐没钱党，加一党以及游戏多的玩不完的人入手，这个游戏没买不急，如果买了还是适合通个关的。

Max: The Curse of Brotherhood es un juego de aventura y plataformas con un toque de puzles, los cuales le dan la esencia que lo distingue y hace que sea totalmente recomendado jugarlo.

Lo primero que nos llama la atención es que todo parece una pelicula de animacion 3D, con una historia simple pero que le otorga un linea por la que avanza el juego.

El punto fuerte del juego es su jugabilidad, ya que es un plataformas muy bueno, a la vez que continuamente tenemos que resolver pequeños puzles para ir avanzando. Estos puzles al principio ni se notan, pero conforme avanzamos van cogiendo fuerza y pasan a ser un elemento muy importante del juego, tal vez el más importante del titulo.

También tenemos objetos recolectables que hace que rejuegues el juego una vez acabado, es mas, siempre podemos volver a rejugar un nivel una vez se haya completado.

En definitiva, Max: The Curse of Brotherhood es un videojuego muy bueno, totalmente recomendado para aquellos amantes de los plataformas y que les gusten pequeños puzles a través del gameplay; y con una estética que hace parecer que estamos viendo una pelicula de animación 3D.

Si queréis ver algo más podéis echarle un ojo al video que os dejo arriba ^^

15547429.review:
[b]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/b] (Platformer-Puzzle)

We have some basic options:  Vibration (if you're using a controller), Sound Effects, Music, Subtitles (NOT on unless you turn them on), and Use Arrow keys (if you prefer not to use or don't have a controller), and then there are settings for the grapics, low, medium, and high.  There are also six languages to choose from.  The game automatically adjusted for my widescreen, but it can be played Windowed by hitting Alt-Enter, if you wish.

The game begins in a very [i][url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0091369/]Labyrinth[/url][/i]-esque way, and it's up to you to save your brother from the trouble you caused for him. ;p  Gameplay starts out as a very basic platformer, but it's not long until you start gaining some powers, and that's where the true charm of the game starts shining through.  The puzzle mechanics are brilliantly realized, ranging anywhere from easy to perplexing, but not to the point of frustration.

I was enjoying the puzzle aspect of the game so much that I was actually a bit disappointed when, in latter levels, we started needing to depend on quick decision-making, and at times, good reflexes!  It wasn't until the final sequence of the game that I remembered -- Oh yeah, this is what platformers used to be all about! (ie. Donkey Kong Country, etc.)  The beauty of these sections is that, while they may be difficult, they are still doable!  It may take a dozen tries, but it CAN be done, AND you don't have to keep starting the level over again to achieve it, as the automatic save-points are well-spaced.

Something I truly love about the game is the graphics.  Sure, they're pretty, but the devs did an amazing job making a side-scrolling platformer *feel* like a 3D game by periodically changing up the perspective.  Beautifully done, devs, I'm very impressed! :D

The music was nicely-chosen, and I enjoyed the voices, as well -- especially some of Max's "YEEES!" moments. lol~

[b]Points to remember:[/b]
 - You can attach vines to a myraid of objects, ranging from branches to boulders and more.
 - Items can be cut at the base OR the tip!
 - Be creative and don't give up!  The devs give us a lot of freedom with our powers, and sometimes it's going to be trial-and-error figuring things out.

There are a couple of things to be on the lookout for whilst you're running around.  They are beholders (plants with eyeballs at the end of a stalk that allow the user to spy on the world) and pieces of an amulet.  These collectibles are not *needed* to complete the game, but they sure do add an extra bit of fun. XD  You can replay a chapter at any time (even after you've completed the game) from via the menu, and looking at the menu during gameplay will show you how many you have left to find on your current level.  In addition, there are 27 Achievements for you to earn, another plus in my books.

Overall, I found [i]Max: The Curse of Brotherhood[/i] to be a delightful game, full of beauty, danger, excitement... and tempered with just a splash of good old fashioned platformer-frustration.  I would say that it's OK to play with older kids, but perhaps not little ones.  There's a big scary monster in there (whom I find to be absolutely fabulous!), but it might upset younger children.

Highly recommended!

15109711.review:
■概要
誰もが子供のころに一度は考えたことがあるだろう
「あいつなんて居なくなればいいのに・・・」
それが現実になったからさぁ大変。
魔物によりさらわれた弟Felixを救出するため
異界へと飛び込んだ兄Maxの冒険を描く
横スクロールパズルアクションアドベンチャーゲーム。

■ゲームプレイ
Maxが唯一異界へ持ち込むことの出来たマジックペン。
これはただのペンではなく魔法のマジックペンだった。
このペンで線を描いた所には足場が現れ、ツタが張られる。
これらを組み合わせることにより、
基本となる横スクロールアクションに
キャラクターの進行経路を作成するパズル要素が加わる。

マウス操作により足場を作るパズル要素だが
難しくなりすぎず、ゲームのテンポが阻害されない。
ゲームの進行状況によってペンが強化され
徐々に出来ることが増えるところも面白い。

アクション要素においては敵への攻撃手段はないので
基本的にジャンプアクションが主体となるのだが、
パズル解決時の「緩」、迫る魔物から走り逃げる「急」と
緩急を上手く使っており、単調な割りに飽き難い。

死んでからの再プレイ時はインターバルが全く無く
次々とチャレンジしていける点はプレイしていて快適。
また、操作性は悪くなく通常プレイをする分にはストレスフリー。
しかし実績解除を狙うほど遣り込むとなると
やや不自由を感じる部分もある。

■総合
概要で本作をアドベンチャーゲームと形容したのは
ストーリーを見せるゲーム構成による。
アクションやパズルの難易度は比較的低く、
ゲーム全体がテンポ良く進み、演出と演出が綺麗に繋がる。
ストーリーなどの全体の進行状況が
プレイヤーの認識から外れないよう意識しているのだろう。
また、マップは砂漠や湿地や洞窟、さらに木の上等々
環境が色々と変化するのでプレイしていて飽きない所も良い。

育成や成長などの遣り込み要素はないが、
全体のストーリーは面白く英語も簡単でお勧めできる。

全体のボリュームは、クリアまで6～7時間ほど、
全実績解除は8時間ほどで達成できる。
（2015/3/30）

14782043.review:
This is probably the best platformer game I've ever played.  You play Max, the big brother of Felix, who gets whisked away by a monster.  You have to find your way through several kinds of obstacles and environments to save him with the help of the powers in a magic marker.  Your marker gets new and different "powers" as you progress.

The graphics, atmosphere, music and voice acting are superb.  Skill is required to use the controls but my favorite part of the game is having to think about how to solve the puzzles by using the powers in the right way.  

The game has several levels and the replay value is enormous.  I'm in my third playthrough and I'm sure I'll be playing it many times in the future.

This was a fun platformer with a cool draw/erase mechanic to help you overcome some of the physics puzzles in the game. It also reminds me very much of the style of cartoon animation used in such shows as Jimmy Neutron. Looks very much like shows such as that.
The game itself features you, Max, trying to save your little brother from an evil scientist-y guy while avoiding his massive monster henchman, various obstacles, and so on along the way.

The gameplay was fairly seamless and this game was very well done in my opinion. The backdrops/scenery was beautifully rendered, and the animations were spot on. I really cant find any flaws with this game, except that maybe the story was a bit lite, but then again, it is set up like a cartoon, so that really isnt surprising necessarily.

14688703.review:
The Verdict

A bright platformer is just what we needed on Xbox One and PC  Max: The Curse of Brotherhood’s vibrant setting and terrain-altering puzzles deliver. But the adventure doesn’t quite feel next-gen. With unintuitive controls, puzzle mechanics that’ve been done better elsewhere, and a story with the depth of a coloring book, it’s hard to stay invested in this short adventure.



Using a giant marker to color your way through the puzzles of Max: The Curse of Brotherhood offers a great-looking and clever twist to the platforming genre. Well, it would if it weren’t so frustrating half the time. Once the novelty of drawing wears off, the curse we’re left with isn’t brotherhood, but awkward controls.

I generally like the idea that I can make drawings to help solve platforming puzzles, even though it’s not as freeform as the concept implies. You get the marker early on, but before you do, climbing ladders and jumping over endless gaps as Max in the beautiful 2.5D environment gives you your first taste of the floaty controls. Cruelly, our little hero is a complete platforming pansy who can't even double-jump; one long-ish fall or hit from just about anything and he'll go down faster than that kid in Limbo. And he went down a lot. This game isn't as cuddly as it appears.

New marker powers come at a nice pace though, and each one has its own vibrant chapter full of briefly interesting ways to use the mechanic. The water temple is dripping with clever puzzles that had me drawing spouts of water to create paths and making boats out of vines. The fire temple, on the other hand, is more of a thrilling race, where the marker helped me to quickly find an escape route from a fiery lava beast. Discovering new ways to utilize the power of the marker is entertaining, and each area offers some fun surprises.
When I could get the marker working, successfully navigating Max through areas using vines, branches, and water spouts together to create a sort of mousetrap sequence was seriously satisfying. Some high-pressure levels towards the end where you’re outrunning lava are particularly epic as well.

14438196.review:
A game that will make you smile, one of those 'feel good' games.

The game is about two brothers, Felix is the one that gets pulled into a mysterious world after his brother cast a spell to get rid of him. Max(you) in disbelieve as to what happened quickly decides to follow his brother in an attempt to rescue him.  The game starts of slowly introducing each mechanic one at the time, the pacing is excellent. You can control natural elements(on fixed positions) within the game world with your magic marker. This is required to get to the end of the level, which are designed very well and look very good in terms of graphics. The puzzles that you need to solve are also well done... though they are not that challenging, but remain fun for players of all skill levels. I like the super hard ones but found myself enjoying this and even getting stuck on some. Having me say to myself when i find the solution "why did i not see that earlier" ,which actually makes me feel dumb instead of smart when i solve it... 
There are also hidden items with levels and "eyes" that you can collect. All your character can do is jump and use the magic marker, so be aware that there is no combat is this game. Though there are ways to kill creatures. 
It has high quality cinematics and excellent voice acting to go along with it. 

If you like adventure platformers with some lite puzzles definitely consider this one.

+High quality cinematics
+Voice acting
+Puzzles
+Fun for all ages
+Interesting platforming
+Just the right length (6-7 hours gameplay) 
+Great visuals

14410976.review:
El rotulador mágico de Pixar

Empezamos hablando de la historia: esta es sencilla pero muy divertida. En el papel de Max debemos rescatar a nuestro pequeño hermano Félix que ha sido secuestrado en un mundo alternativo lleno de peligros y demás fantasías.  Nos embarcaremos en esta colosal odisea con la ayuda de un rotulador mágico el cual nos permitirá realizar trucos únicos. Tal como se ve en el tráiler, aquí es donde reside lo mejor del juego, pues con este utensilio encontraremos una jugabilidad en el mundo de las plataformas muy original, placentera y distinta a lo que estamos acostumbrados. Todo esto con un control impecable que no te defraudará.
Los gráficos cumplen correctamente y el diseño de los numerosos niveles es una gozada. Estos son muy variopintos y cuidados hasta el más mínimo detalle. Se nota el mimo con el que han hecho el juego. Correremos por áridos desiertos, a través de la oscuridad por senderos silvestres, escalaremos bosques frondosos, nos perderemos por cuevas oscuras, cráteres de lava, pantanos mohosos, cascadas colosales  y más lugares que te sorprenderán. "Max the curse of brotherhood" es lo mejor del género plataformas que encontrarás por Steam y está justo delante de ti.

Lo mejor: increíble variedad de niveles y situaciones, derrocha fantasía por los cuatro costados, muy rejugable para conseguir logros y volver a maravillarte con los escenarios. Videos estilo "Pixar" que te agradarán.
Lo peor:  el aspecto infantil (no dejes que te engañe), no querrás que llegue a su fin.

14239367.review:
Довольно интересный платформер, способный скрасить пару вечеров. Оговорюсь сразу, что завязка, как и сюжет здесь довольно банальны, как и местные шутки, но в этой игре мы явно не за этим. Главная причина того, почему стоит поиграть – [u]геймплей[/u]. 

Мы играем за [b]Макса[/b], пытающегося спасти своего брата, а в руки к нам попадает волшебный [u]маркер[/u] - вот в этом вот чуде и заключается весь интерес. С помощью маркера, в определенных местах, мы сможем рисовать лианы, толстые ветки с различными изгибами, поднимать импровизированную колонну из земли, просто освещать себе путь и прочее. Чем дальше мы продвигаемся по сюжету – тем больше способностей мы можем использовать. На благо этому чуду замечательно работает [u]физический движок[/u], благодаря которому, порой, даже получается пройти определенное место совсем иным способом: однажды мне случайно удалось обмотать лиану вокруг выступающей части отвесной скалы, благодаря чему я попал в нужное место, хотя задумано было иначе… 

В отдельные моменты, помимо решения загадок, мы будем улепетывать от гигантского монстра, или от надвигающейся магмы, при этом, все что находится за нами разрушается неприятелями, довольно звучно и красиво, порой, все это добро даже летит в экран, закрывая на секунду обзор… 

Что вызывает удивление, все это сделано на движке – [b]Unity[/b], довольно неплохом, но и не хватающем звезд с неба. Все погони очень динамичны, а прыжков ровно столько, чтобы не надоедать, к сожалению, управление нашим протеже далеко не самое удобное, персонаж, довольно, непослушно отзывается на команды. Но как я упомянул, хоть это и платформер, сложных прыжков тут не много, а больше реально интересных загадок, причем довольно оригинальных. Разработчикам удалось нащупать грань, когда нужно дать нам новую способность, либо скинуть на голову ворох новых ситуаций, чтобы не вызывать лишних зевотных позывов, спасибо за это огромное. Редко встречающиеся враги, хоть и довольно глупы, но смотрятся здесь довольно кстати и отыгрывают свое слабоумие так, чтобы мы не думали, что это огрехи игры – даже персонаж скажет пару фраз на этот счет, довольно умный ход.:)

Заставки сделаны не на движке, а нарисованы как любой привычный компьютерный мультик, что игре уж точно не в минус. Локации в игре очень красивы и временами на них просто хочется любоваться, но есть и те, что могут наскучить и разочаровать, довольно монотонные, либо затянутые и это печалит больше всего, разработчики будто увлекшись загадками и ситуациями, порой, забывали про окружение. Как пример, локация с джунглями очень пресная, а пещеры и лавовые уровни [i](которые были просто обязательны в платформерах годов этак 90-х)[/i] здесь просто ни к чему. У разработчиков будто бы не хватило фантазии, времени или желания. Ведь в игре есть замечательные локации с болотами, где вдалеке сквозь деревья, проглядывает полнолуние, по пути попадаются милые фонарные столбики и все вокруг создает ощущение Тима Бертоновсой атмосферы, или пустынная локация, с разрушенными, но живописными домами, мрачные стены неприступного замка и прочее. 

Игра временами может напомнить [b]Limbo[/b], если игру окрасить в те же тона, то сходство будет на лицо, т.к. мальчику, которым мы играем достается ни чуть не меньше, только смерть мы не видим, т.к. игра ориентирована и на детей, хотя я не уверен, что марафон с прыжками дети смогут одолеть, как и решить большинство задач. Только расхваленный лимб, кроме как бойким началом, атмосферой и перехваленностью, не мог похвастать больше ничем, растеряв весь свой потенциал к середине игры и спасала его только маленькая продолжительность. Что же касается [b]Max[/b]’а – чем мы больше играем, тем больше игра набирает оборотов и не скатывает себя в пучину геймплейных решений, которые мы видели пару сотен раз. 

Смело могу рекомендовать любителям платформеров и оригинальных [i](хоть и не столь сложных)[/i] загадок. К сожалению, у движка есть и обратная сторона медали, игру можно было сделать еще красивее, тем более она разрабатывалась под консоль нового поколения. 

[h1]Как таковой, реиграбельностью игра не обладает, но одно хорошее, не унылое и красивое прохождение она способна подарить.

13949996.review:
Awesome, well polished platformer that combined drawing with platforming/puzzle elements. It reminded me of Nihilumbra which is similar except it's not 2.5D and didn't have backing of a larger studio like this one. Its definitely worth playing as its addictive, has good variety of platforming and achievements which are not too difficult but not easy either.

Pros:
 - Great graphics, sound/music is ok
 - Decent story line
 - Combining elements works well, excellent logic puzzles
 - Gets difficulty just right, addictive

Cons:
 - Whomever decided to introduce a delay whenever you wanted to moved the cursor so you could draw should be shot. I never knew where my cursor was going to pop up, resulting in a lot of deaths before I could defend Max.
- Achievements can be little buggy/slow to show up, but they eventually do.
- On Windows, the game likes to drop FPS at times to unplayable levels (15-20fps), ALT-TABing restores it to 60fps.

If you love platformers, do yourself a favor and pick this up 9/10.

13798152.review:
Nos ponemos en la piel de Max para meternos de lleno en la búsqueda de su hermano, al que él mismo ha hecho desaparecer. Argumento sencillo y de aspecto infantil para introducirnos en uno de los mejores plataformas que he jugado últimamente y con el que he quedado gratamente sorprendido.

Excepcional en todos los aspectos. Lo más importante, una jugabilidad exquisita gracias al plataformeo puro y al uso del rotulador mágico para ayudar al personaje a superar los niveles. Sin olvidarnos de las físicas, que también juegan un buen papel. Además, cuenta con bastantes puzzles (no muy complicados) y muchas partes de huídas en las que no podemos perder la coordinación y los reflejos. Entretenido de principio a fin, siendo además un juego que mejora por momentos a medida que avanzas, gracias en parte a la consecución de nuevas habilidades para el rotulador, que no hacen otra cosa que dar más y más variedad a la jugabilidad. Los niveles finales son sencillamente sublimes.

El juego se presenta con unos gráficos y unos diseños espectaculares, con escenarios y niveles variados, muy bonitos y vistosos, que le dan un toque "mágico", manténiendose en todo momento muy estable, sin fallos notables que afeen el apartado visual o jugable. Tan sólo he notado caídas de frame rate en un par de escenarios grandes al final del juego, nada más. 

Puede durar unas 7-8 horas sin pararse mucho a conseguir los coleccionables o a sacar logros.

En resumen, un juego IMPRESCINDIBLE para todo amante de las plataformas. Una mezcla de sabores clásicos con ideas nuevas, con una puesta en escena preciosa y un apartado sonoro que, sin destacar mucho, encaja a la perfección. Un juego no muy complicado, que se disfruta mucho de princpio a fin y que irremediablemente deja a uno con ganas de más. Puro amor.

En ofertas se pone por menos de 4€, por lo que merece bastante la pena. Y el que quiera probarlo antes tiene disponible una demo en la propia Steam.

13777231.review:
ATENÇÃO: Verifique se sua placa de vídeo é compatível com o jogo, pois em algumas (como a minha, Geforce 750M) o título não funciona apropriadamente, ficando muito escura a tela. Tive que finalizar o jogo de outra maneira.

Pontos negativos: 

*Além do mencionado acima, se você gosta de jogos muito difíceis ou valoriza somente a mecânica em um jogo, não compre Max! A maior parte dos puzzles é fácil e o jogo tem uma introdução bastante longa (leva bastante tempo para surgirerem alguns puzzles desafiadores).

*A história é bastante pobre (não farei spoilers significativos), que teve origem no desentendimento entre os irmãos - achei um motivo bastante fútil. Sei que estou avaliando com bastante rigor esse aspecto, mas acho que a transmissão de valores em uma história é muito importante. O irmão mais velho provoca o sofrimento do mais novo (fazendo-o desaparecer) e, depois, é esse quem mais sofre durante o jogo, esperando passivamente o resgate. 
Enquanto o irmão mais velho está se divertindo e achando muito legal os poderes e aventuras que está exposto no outro mundo, o irmão mais novo, coitado, está acorrentado, de cabeça para baixo.
No final, como não é o foco da história, não há qualquer tipo de punição para o irmão mais velho. Pelo contrário, ele é reconhecido por achievement do Steam como um super heroi! Acho que ele está mais para anti heroi, no máximo. Como o enredo é bastante palpável com o mundo real - brigas entre irmãos acontecem todos os dias, eu não acho que esse jogo transpareça uma mensagem positiva para as crianças. Ainda que o irmão mais velho tente se redimir tentando salvá-lo, dá a impressão de que tudo valeu a pena porque foi divertido e porque, no final, eles não brigam mais. Contudo, isso significaria dizer que valeu a pena o sofrimento pelo qual o irmão mais novo passou, o que é um absurdo. Enfim, acho que a ética passou longe desse jogo.

*Ainda que o jogo seja mais casual e amigável (por ter desafios simples), acho que seria apropriado se tivesse a opção de acessar os checkpoints de cada fase, pois às vezes você esqueceu alguma coisa no final e precisa passar tudo de novo para coletar um recurso. Ajudaria muito os jogadores que pretendem passar com 100%.

*Não há recompensa por coletar todos os olhos ou todas as peças do amuleto da senhora. Por ser um jogo que tem muitas cutscenes, faltou ao menos uma cena especial  de comemoração para os jogadores que exploraram o jogo inteiro.

Pontos positivos:

*Se você é apaixonado por jogos com gráficos envolventes como eu, esse jogo é pra você. O jogo é muito bem polido, tendo diversos exemplos no decorrer do jogo (a tela de fundo do jogo no menu principal muda conforme você passa os capítulos, nunca tinha visto algo assim, muito bem feito). 

*É um jogo bastante coeso: tem introdução e epílogo em vídeo, o jogo apresenta as mecânicas com bastante cautela e explora razoavelmente bem essas mecânicas depois, então o resultado é bastante satisfatório.

13741134.review:
Tanti di noi avranno sicuramente avuto a che fare con dei pestiferi fratellini, che usavano senza permesso i nostri giochi lasciandoli alla rinfusa o che, non paghi di tutti gli attacchi nervosi che ci causavano quotidianamente, ci addossavano le colpe di un guaio, e la mamma credeva sempre a loro perchè erano più piccoli coccoloni.
Da queste premesse parte la trama del titolo sotto esame. Siamo nei panni di un bambino chiamato Max, che al ritorno da scuola trova il fratellino Felix mentre sta usando i suoi giocattoli. Stufo di questa situazione, Max cerca sul suo PC se esiste un modo per far scomparire il fratellino antipatico, e riesce a trovarlo: peccato che una gigantesca mano proveniente da un'altra dimensione lo rapisca veramente e lo porti dentro a un portale. A questo punto Max si getta alla ricerca di Felix, in un mondo parallelo popolato da strane creature sottostanti al controllo mentale di uno stregone cattivo di nome Mustacho. 
Da queste premesse ci ritroveremo dunque catapultati nei panni dell'eroico bambino in un mondo fantastico denso di minacce: il Gameplay si sviluppa come un classico platform in 2D, basando tutta la sua ossatura ludica sul risolvimento di alcuni enigmi ambientali e superamento di ostacoli durante alcune entusiasmanti fughe in cui la prontezza di riflessi e una buona dose di fortuna sono essenziali per sopravvivere. MAX:TCOB si snoda essenzialmente sotto questi due aspetti, affrontabili con l'elemento essenziale del protagonista, ovvero il suo pennarello, che nel mondo di Mustacho acquisirà poteri magici sempre più vari. Questo oggetto è essenziale per il superamento di moltissime fasi che ci troveremo ad affrontare: tramite la pressione di un tasto dorsale potremo tirarlo fuori dal nostro zaino, facendo in modo tale che assuma dimensioni gigantesche. A questo punto sarà nostro compito muoverlo a seconda delle situazioni per fare in modo che vengano sfruttati alcuni elementi ambientali predisposti all'interazione con l'oggetto: potremo ad esempio alzare delle rocce per permetterci di attraversare dei dirupi; creare delle liane; dare vita a vortici di acqua o ancora a palle di fuoco per abbattere i nemici, altrimenti inaffrontabili. Il titolo riesce a donare dunque una buona varietà di gioco, alternando saggiamente enigmi ambientali che stimolano la materia grigia ad altre situazioni più estreme in cui saremo spesso chiamati a darcela a gambe da alcune minacce, con la nostra prontezza di riflessi che verrà messa a dura prova. Entrambi questi aspetti vengono sicuramente resi più profondi dall'utilizzo rispettivamente ragionato e immediato del pennarello che ne consegue. Le due meccaniche funzionano più che bene, se non fosse che spesso, nella fasi di fuga, ci troviamo di fronte ad alcuni fatali momenti dall'anima trial and error, ovvero situazioni in cui il titolo non fa altro che farci affrontare una situazione praticamente impossibile da superare al primo tentativo, con lo scopo di farci ragionare sui nostri errori per stimolarci a capire come rimediare. Si tratta di un certo tipo di progressione ludica che da sempre ha incontrato tanti amanti così come altrettanti detrattori, fatto sta che in questo contesto purtroppo questo tipo di meccanica ci è sembrato un po' forzato: ci saranno vari momenti, durante le fasi di fuga, in cui il titolo ad esempio rallenterà per permetterci di vedere con più calma l'ambiente e decidere come usare il pennarello per evitare cadute mortali. Il problema sta proprio nel fatto che spesso i tempi di lettura di queste fasi sono impossibili da saturare al primo tentativo, visto che nell'arco di 3-4 secondi dovremo: analizzare l'ambiente circostante; capire dove sono eventuali appigli per il pennarello; utilizzarlo nella maniera corretta. Insomma, 3 momenti che sono praticamente impossibili da correlare in una volta sola, nonostante il titolo dia l'illusione che sia plausibile farlo. L'adrenalina di queste situazioni rocambolesche per fortuna non viene intaccata, considerata la spettacolarità che le correda, ma in ogni caso un sistema che guidasse con più cautela il giocatore nella sua veloce progressione poteva essere implementato. Funzionano meglio le fasi incentrate sugli enigmi ambientali, che ci chiedono di sfruttare in maniera creativa tutti i poteri del pennarello a nostra disposizione, prendendoci tutto il tempo di ragionare su come procedere. Anche qua, molto spesso gli errori coincidono con la morte del bambino. Si tratta insomma di un titolo ostico, come da tradizione del genere, in cui ogni azione avventata si paga cara. Per fortuna non sfocia mai nella frustrazione, grazie ad un ottimo sistema di autosalvataggio che ci consente di riprendere dal punto immediatamente precedente alla nostra dipartita, senza che ci sia un numero limitato di vite che mette troppa pressione. 
Dal punto di vista grafico MAX: TCOB presenta uno stile da cartoon digitale di notevole spessore: i filmati sembrano non a caso dei film di animazione veri e propri, mentre le fasi di Gameplay mostrano un medesimo grado di ricerca artistico/visiva, che sembra appunto calarci in un mondo fantastico contornato dai tratti stilistici dei contemporanei cartoni animati, in cui stonano soltanto alcune animazioni inerenti al movimento dei personaggi, basate su schemi poco variegati. 
Dal punto di vista audio il titolo presenta delle musiche di buon impatto con ogni situazione che affronteremo, coadiuvate da un'effettistica sonora nella norma e un doppiaggio originale che accentua bene il tono goliardico e grottesco dell'avventura, completabile mediamente in circa 5 ore, anche se molto dipenderà dal vostro grado di abilità con questi giochi.
A conti fatti MAX: TCOB è un platform ben strutturato e sviluppato, che riporta sugli schermi un'avventura in 2D tosta, ma per fortuna mai frustrante. Un titolo che intrattiene bene e diverte senza troppe pretese eccessive qualunque giocatore, mantenendo intatta la sua linea di progressione basata su meccaniche semplici, ma assolutamente mai banali. Consigliato. 

GAMEPLAY: 8,0

GRAFICA: 8,5

LONGEVITA': 7,5

AUDIO: 7,5

VOTO: 7,8   BUONO

13713153.review: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is the sequel and Max & the Magic Marker.  This time around it's a 2.5D experience of Max trying to rescue the brother he accidentally wished would disappear.  This time the magic marker can only be used in specific locations and can only draw specific types of aids for Max to accomplish his goals (i.e. water, vines, raise platforms, etc...).  There is less freedom than in the last game, but that doesn't stop this game from being a great game.  The levels are well set up to allow for good puzzles to be solved and for the platforming portion of the game to be somewhat difficult at times where timing is everything.  The graphics are beautiful and the sounds and voice acting is perfect for this type of game.  Great fun for kids and adults.

13663587.review:
如果正在浏览这款游戏，那么不要犹豫了，赶快入手。
下面我来说说游戏：
1.内容：讲述的是麦克斯在放学后回家看见弟弟在玩自己的玩具，并且拆了自己的玩具，然后他打开笔记本在giggle（游戏中就是这样的，微软的游戏嘛，坚决不给谷歌打广告，哈哈）上搜索如何摆脱自己的弟弟，然后找到几句咒语，他情不自禁读了出来，然后就坏了，他弟弟被抓走了，接下来就是玩家扮演麦克斯去救弟弟的故事。在路上他遇到一个老太婆，她把自己的灵魂附在麦克斯的画笔里面，然后我们就踏上了用画笔解救弟弟的旅途。读完这些是不是感觉很有意思？

2.画面：在测评这款游戏之前我刚写完《兄弟：双子传说》的测评，玩过双子传说的人可能会被游戏画面吸引，这款游戏亦有异曲同工之妙，画面没的说，微软的产品确实不赖！这里给巨硬赞一个。这里强调一下，这款游戏属于横板游戏，游戏中我们会遇到荒漠、绿林……各种环境，画面精美，随便截一张图都可以让你好好欣赏，绝对是艺术品。

3.操作：我们要做的就是使用WASD控制麦克斯的上下左右移动，用鼠标控制画笔，所以操作很简单。画笔根据不同情景可以画出泥土柱、树枝、藤条，然后麦克斯通过画出来的东西通过难关，所以很有创意。操作很棒！但是很多地方很有难度，如果你想把所有的碎片以及眼睛都找到的话，难度会加大不少。

4.题外话：神笔马良是咱们中国的故事，但是我们中国却没有人使用这一祖先留传下来的创意，别人做的反而很出色，这是一个特别不好的现象，希望我们也能开发出如此精良的作品，加油吧！祖国的开发者们。

最后一如既往我来给游戏打分：
内容：10/10.
画面：10/10.
音乐：10/10.
操作：10/10.

这款游戏给巨硬打全满分，期待更好的作品！

13543649.review:
[h1] Брат, Браток, Братишка [/h1]

[b] Думал что игра не оправдает свои ожидания, но оказалось то что игра получилась наоборот очень даже годной. Сюжет игры нам рассказывает про двух братьев — Макса и Феликса. Однажды, Макс пожелал, чтобы его братка забрали неизвестные силы. И по иронии судьбы произошло страшное — глупая мысль воплотилась в реальность. Когда Макс осознал, что натворил, то вооружился маркером и отправился в путешествие на поиски родного братана. Напоминает кстати фильм Лабиринт 1986 года. Кто видел, тот поймет о чем я говорю. [/b]

[i] Геймплей очень схож с игрой Trine, а это уже означает что плохого можно не ожидать. Самая главная фишка в геймплее это маркер ! да, маркер ! с ним всю игры вы проведете, ибо без него вы не как собственно игру то и не пройдете. В каждой новой главе открываются улучшения для вашего фломастера, и за такую оригинальностью разрабам спасибо. 

Как я уже говорил, игра схожа с Trine, особенно атмосферой,но лично мне показалось что атмосфера этой игры ни чем не хуже, ибо тут все так выглядит симпатично, особенно персонажи игры. 

Управление в игре очень удобное, хотя как я помню это порт с Xbox One, и он получился неплохим, правда на клаве с мышкой играть в некоторых местах удобнее ежели чем на геймпаде. 

Графика на высшем уровне, ну просто отличный дизайн. Unity далеко идут со своим движком, каждый раз они меня поражают. Видео правда мыльное, хотя это же порт, так что к этому можно и не придираться. 

К сожалению я нашел минус который меня огорчил, игра короткая ! если проходить игру на быструю руку, то вам хватит 4 часа чтоб пройти её. Но а если не торопясь, и собирая ништяки в игре, то 7-8 часов вам гарантированны. Ну и на последок хочу сказать, если вам нравиться Trine, то и эта  игра не оставит вас равнодушным. [/i]

[u]  [i] [b] 9 заклинаний из 10.  [/b] [/i] [/u]

13278244.review:
画面很卡通，操作很容易上手，神笔马良的游戏方式的加入使得玩法上很新颖。

游戏难度真的是超级简单啊。无论是普通流程还是boss战，都是非常明了的能一瞬间看出通关方法，。
所有关卡中，一半以上关卡的流程都是，本关卡获得新的能力，然后那一章基本就要一直反复使用那种方法了，很平常的重复使用单一一种能力，反反复复的重复使用同一种能力，并不能带来多大的游戏性，用多了反而会感到枯燥，重复多了会略感无聊。
只有5-1关卡，熔岩boss的时候，才体会到了各种能力的来回替换使用以及时间上的紧迫感。

另外，有过场cg的存档点，好烦啊，每次死了都要重新播放一遍3.4秒秒的cg动画。 π_π

另另外，值得夸的一点，游戏里面有一个"子弹时间"（或许叫"画笔时间"更合适），代入感特别棒，这点一定要赞出来。

另另另外关于收集要素，基本上一路走慢点仔细看，差不多一周目就能收集个九成。一共有两种收集物品，但是蛋疼的是收集齐全后并赋予新的能力，或者对于二周目有什么新增篇章，都没有....仅仅就是一个steam成就，差评→_→




总得来说，适合动作苦手和想休闲的玩家。

7/10评价

ps.最终boss简单的令人发指！！第一次打就打过了...

13243355.review:
Este Max: The Curse of Brotherhood es un juego de plataformas/pluzzles lanzado en diciembre para One y este mayo para 360 y PC. El juego nos cuenta la historia de dos hermanos donde el mayor, que como todo hermano mayor, piensa que bien estaría sin su molesto hermano pequeño, todo esto acaba con el susodicho tragado por un portal.
Nuestra misión consistirá en rescatarlo, a través de un mundo de fantasía.
Como he dicho el juego es un plataformas que añade la característica de un rotulador para quitar, unir, crear plataformas que nos faciliten el avance. Esta base jugable funciona bien y su respuesta es optima en casi todas las circunstancias, y digo casi porque cuando tienes que dibujar algo rápido a veces no te da tiempo y toca reiniciar.
En si el juego es corto, poco rejugable y bastante sencillo por lo que tampoco creo que sea esencial, se lo recomiendo a la gente que llegadas las vacaciones no tenga a que jugar y busque una aventura sencilla y amena.

Donde mas me ha decepcionado es en su apartado artístico, ya que intenta imitar la animación del archiconocido estudio Pixar pero sin conseguirlo, en verdad, cuenta con mas oscuros que claros. Y si hablamos gráficamente el juego no destaca para nada, siendo simplemente aceptable.

13159418.review:
Juego de plataformas y puzzles protagonizado por un niño llamado Max, que tendrá que valerse de un poderoso rotulador mágico para escapar de un peligroso mundo alternativo en el que su hermano pequeño ha quedado atrapado.

Jugabilidad: Es excelente, la variedad, controles y niveles es muy amplio. Lo mejor del juego son sus escenarios tan detallados y coloridos. Manejaremos a Max el cual posee un rotulador mágico que nos ofrecerá los poderes elementales para poder pasar los niveles y así rescatar a Felix, nuestro hermano pequeño.

Gráficos: Como ya he mencionado, el nivel de detalle de los escenarios es excelente y también la variedad de ellos.

Sonido: El juego está en inglés subtitulado al Español pero las voces están muy logradas y los efectos tanto del agua, fuego y ruidos son muy reales. La banda sonora esta también muy chula.

Duración: El juego me ha durado exactamente unas 7 horas en completarlo aunque me quedan algunos extras (como los ojos). Podría haber sido mas largo pero quizás se hubiera vuelto cansino y repetitivo.

Conclusión: Un gran, rapidísimo juego de plataformas que me ha recordado a Limbo o al Brothers: A tale of two sons (otros juegazos) el cual que me ha gustado mucho y recomiendo totalmente. La historia del juego y sus puzzles (sencillos) pero que te hará pensar varias veces.

13084579.review:
Ever had an annoying sibling that you wish/wished you could magic away? Well Max: The Curse of Brotherhood will scratch that itch for you!. :P
You'll also have to deal with the consequences of your heinous action, you awful person you, and experience some thrilling platforming and puzzle-solving which will challenge you throughout your journey along the simple but beautifully animated-story. The puzzles themselves are very-well thought out and will make you stop to think as they increase in complexity as you unlock the progressively more powerful (puzzle-solving) abilities that force you to combine and employ them in unconventional ways.
I also didn't find the trial-and-error method to completing some of the potentially aggravating chases and other such sequences to be an impediment to my enjoyment as I still remember gaming on the Atari/Nintendo/Genesis and this was part-and-parcel of the experience back then. Some people may find this 'cheap' difficulty to be off-putting in this modern day and age of gaming but to them I say "Suck it it isn't that hard!" :P
The major issue I did have with the game was with its control scheme where the game is best played with a gamepad where movement is concerned but can be somewhat cumbersome when drawing with the magic marker. With the latter it may be best to use your mouse as it is smoother and more effective and I found myself switching back and forth during the more complicated parts of the game.

Also, all achievements baby, yeah! xD

8/10

12739247.review:
Having grown up with two younger brothers, I can empathize to Max’s annoyance at his younger brother Felix fiddling with his stuff, making a mess of his room, and seeming to exist only to get on his nerves. I might not have gone so far as to enact an occult rite and banish my brothers to an unknown fantasy world (though I might have wanted to at times), but at least Max realizes the gravity of what he unintentionally did pretty fast and sets off to save his brother from a creepy old man who intends to steal his youth, Gruntilda the Witch style.

A sequel mostly in name and lead character only to Max and the Magic Marker, The Curse of Brotherhood almost entirely ditches the free form drawing that made up the core of its predecessor, opting instead to streamline its mechanics and add a significant amount of cinematic flair, coming together in a far more focused, inspired, and varied experience.

Though it is still referred to as a marker, Max’s tool of choice has been reworked into a powerful instrument with which you can now control various elements in order to help Max traverse through levels. The implementation of this still bares a resemblance to Max’s marker of old, allowing you a small amount of freedom to direct elements into specific shapes and paths, but it’s far more natural and embedded in the experience than before and works well within the constraints of a controllers precision, rarely requiring a great deal of precision and only occasionally imposing any sort of time limit.

The Curse of Brotherhood has rather obviously been designed so as to rarely frustrate the player, or tax them with tricky platforming segments or puzzles, and this simplicity and hand holding is in some ways a bit tedious when the answer is almost always immediately apparent, but overall I actually found the breezy pace rather refreshing. It allowed me to appreciate the gorgeous environments and enjoyably cliched story without many threats or pauses as I got stuck. It provides just enough stimulation to remain engaging, but is accessible enough that it’s a game I could feel confident recommending to a younger player or a parent wanting to play with their child (which is a disappointingly low number of games).

At around 4-5 hours it’s a fairly brisk adventure, but I never felt as if something was cut or missing, nor did any moment feel like needless filler. Every segment is interesting and important to the game, and this consistency and constant variety makes it easy to wind up playing through the entire thing in but a few sittings. That’s not a slight against the game by any means, but a complement to its excellent pacing and inspired level design.

The handful of moments that stand out as poor in my mind are actually those near the end which begin to ask more of the player than before, and the slightly awkward controls have a bit of trouble keeping up. The end boss fight also proved the most disappointing part of the game, with an uninspired encounter that ups the difficulty just enough to be frustrating and would have ended the game on a rather lackluster note had it not been for the charming cutscene immediately following.

It’s probably an understatement to say I was rather taken aback by how much I ended up enjoying The Curse of Brotherhood. Its beautiful scenery pulled me in, and the leisurely platforming and puzzle solving kept me there throughout an experience that continued to surprise me the further I got in. Some may scoff at the low difficulty, but in terms of simple fun and creativity I haven’t played something quite as nice for too long.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/11/02/max-and-the-curse-of-brotherhood-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]
